- Meet the Masters of Evil
- Worthy of a True Zemo
- Didn't Odin Banish You?
- The Black Knight Lives Again!

Playable missions description: Baron Zemo and his Masters of Evil are up to no good when they attempt to lure out the Avengers and defeat them in this re-telling of the classic 1963 comic book adventure.

221439.name: Lego Marvel's Avengers - Classic Black Panther Character & Level Pack
221439.description:
User Summary

Purchasable DLC also available via the Season Pass.

This DLC adds the following items:

- The Classic Black Panther playable missions and once completed, the level's Freeplay mode.

10 playable characters:
Aragorn
Black Knight(Augustine du Lac)
Black Panther
Dora Milaje Warrior
Killmonger
Man-Ape (M'Baku)
Shuri
Ulysses Klaw(Classic)
White Wolf

- 1 new vehicle: Black Panther Skybike

- 5 Trophy achievements:
King of Wakanda
Panther's Rage
Quick As A Cat
The Most Dangerous Man Alive
Who Is The Black Panther?

Playable missions description: Play through the origin story of Black Panther and his sister Shuri. After Wakanda is invaded, solve the conflict, rescue your mother and defeat the evil Klaw.

221440.name: Lego Marvel's Avengers - All-New, All-Different Doctor Strange Character & Level Pack
221440.description:
User Summary

Purchasable DLC also available via the Season Pass.

This DLC adds the following items:

- The All-New All-Different Dr. Strange playable missions and once completed, the level's Freeplay mode.

- 8 playable characters:
Baron Mordo
Clea
Doctor Strange
Doctor Voodoo
Dormammu
Jennifer Kale
Mindless One Warrior
Night Nurse


- 5 Trophy achievements:
Danger From The Dark Dimension
Master Of The Mystic Arts
Sorcerer Supreme
Strange Tales
Voodoo Chilled

Playable missions description: Dr. Strange and his ally Clea travel to the Dark Dimension to take on Dorammu and Mordo.

221441.name: Lego Marvel's Avengers - Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. Character & Level Pack
221441.description:
User Summary

Purchasable DLC also available via the Season Pass.

This DLC adds the following items:

The Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. playable missions and once completed, the level's Freeplay mode.

13 playable characters:
- Agent Daisy Johnson
- Agent Leo Fitz
- Agent Koenig
- Agent Melinda May
- Agent Bobbi Morse
- Agent Jemma Simmons
- Cal Johnson/Mr.Hyde
- Deathlok
- Gordon
- Grant Ward
- Jiaying
- Lincoln
- Raina

1 New Vehicle
- The Bus

5 Trophy achievements:
- Afterlife Ambush
- A Part of Something Bigger
- I'm Engineering She's Bio-Chem
- Just Need You To Drive The Bus
- We Are Not 'Agents of Nothing'

Playable missions description: After failing to negotiate a peaceful agreement with the Inhumans, the Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. find that the S.H.I.E.L.D. Helicarrier has been by group. It is now up to the team to neutralize the threat and discover the secrets of the Afterlife.

221442.name: Lego Marvel's Avengers - Thunderbolts Character Pack
221442.description:
User Summary

The Thunderbolts Character Pack brings the Thunderbolts team into the game. The Thunderbolts are a group of super villains disguised as heroes.

Included in this DLC are the characters: Citizen V, Atlas, Mach 5, Songbird, Meteorite, Techno and Jolt.

221443.description:
Wooden discs and stickers, to replace the cardboard fraction tokens for the victory point board, also including the Texas & Hegemony faction.

Was initially part of the 2016 released 51st State: Master Set pre-order promos, but released separately in the webshop later on.
221443.name: 51st State: Master Set – Wooden Pawns and Stickers

221444.name: Hollywood Presents
221444.description:
User Summary
Four tapes with five of the great movies of it's time:
Tape 1 and Tape 2 contains Platoon, where Tape 1 is the Standard load and Tape 2 has the Fast load

Tape 3 have The Great Escape and Top Gun with Standard load in the label side, and Fast load of the games on the reverse side.

Tape 4 works the same way for Rambo (1985 Cassette) and Miami Vice

221445.name: Mancala & Friends
221445.description:
User Summary

Classic Mancala game with single player and multiplayer online modes.

221446.name: Wheel of Fortune Free Play
221446.description:
Wheel of Fortune Free Play invites you to be a contestant on Wheel of Fortune! Jump into the Emmy-winning TV game show you know and love by spinning the Wheel, solving new puzzles created by the show’s producers, and collecting souvenirs and prizes as you travel through the World Tour. Challenge your friends and family to head to head matches, compete in tournaments and play with millions of other players from around the world!

Source: The Developer Website.

221447.name: Do No Harm
221447.description:
From the Publishers homepage:

The Finesse Game

Every runner knows there are times when you need to throw grenades at gasoline trucks, and other times when more discretion and subtlety is called for. True pros distinguish themselves with precise operations that are noticed by no one besides their target—but those targets see enough to push them over the edge of sanity.

In this Mission, runners get an assignment that is easy to describe but difficult to execute. The job? Ruin a life. The method? That’s where the runners come in. They’ll have to exercise all their creativity and sneakiness to plan and pull off this job—unless they want the police and some nasty corporate security putting their work to an early end. Do runners have the smarts, stealth, and deviousness to pull this off? As always, the answer is another question: How badly do they want to get paid?

Do No Harm is the latest Shadowrun Mission set in Chicago, bringing a new twist and degree of freedom to runners who take it on. The Mission is for use with Shadowrun, Fifth Edition, and plot elements could also be used with Shadowrun: Anarchy.

221448.description:
Based on the 1950's TV series of the same name. It is a detective game with some similarities to Cluedo in that the aim of the game is to identify the murderer.
Up to 4 players use a telephone shaped spinner to move around the board collecting clues. Clues are recorded on crime sheets and the first player to correctly identify the murderer is the winner.
The board comprises of 6 bedrooms, a bathroom, reception and Sabers office. Squares around these rooms allow players to move around the board depending on the number they spin.
There are 4 wooden playing pieces and a spinner. There are 6 card men (one of which is the murderer) and a card body (a woman). The card men are stood in wooden blocks. There are also 6 clues cards (only 5 used in any one game) and 6 cards keys, silvered on one side and with a letter referring to a bedroom on the other.
221448.name: Saber of London

221449.name: Super-GAUdi
221449.description:
In Super-GAUdi each player is a boss of an nuclear energy company. Each player starts with 7 barrels full of atomic waste and has to put them to one of the final storages on the playing schedule. The player that gets rid of all his barrels at first, wins the game. The clue is, that the players can either put a barrel to one of the hidden final storages or they can look if a final storage is safe or note safe. During the game each players knows some safe and some unsafe storages. After a player put a barrel with atomic waste to one of the final storage-cards, the other players can say that they don't believe that this final storage is safe. If they are right, the player has to take all the barrels on this card (up to three). If he was honest, he gives one of his barrels to the player that distrusted him.

Flavor text:
"Die Geschäfte laufen wie geschmiert, doch die Chefs der großen Atomkonzerne haben ein Problem: Sie wissen nicht wohin mit dem ganzen Atommüll. Es gilt also endlich ein "Endlager" zu finden, auf Teufel komm raus! Sei es ein gammeliges Bergwerk, ein Naturschutzgebiet oder der Kühlschrank von Mutti - no Risk, no Fun! Bleibt nur zu hoffen, dass der Bluff nicht auffliegt... Gewonnen hat derjenige Atomboss, der seinen ganzen Atommüll als Erster los ist."

221450.name: Rummy Plus
221450.description:
User Summary

Rummy Plus game with network multiplayer.

221451.name: Legendary Hybrids: Doomguard
221451.description:
From publisher blurb:

Doomed to Die

Legendary Hybrids: Doomguard is the latest volume in our series of class-focused player supplements, introducing a new series of hybrid classes like those in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Advanced Class Guide that blend the core elements of two different base classes into a unique synergy all their own. The Doomguard brings you a 20-level hybrid class that combines the deadly hunting skills, specialized combat prowess, and focused wrath of the ranger with the glorious defiance and battlefield of the cavalier, with a special twist: a terrible and dire doom that follows him like an oracle's curse and binds him to his fated enemies at whose hands he is doomed to die! You can select from 45 different dooms, from maimed and blinded to powerless prophet and stigmata! You'll also find favored class bonuses for core races and a quartet of amazing archetypes, from the dauntless and daring challenger, the defensive bulwark of the doomwarden, the fey foundling orphan with a forgotten lineage but connections to the mystical world of the fey, and the dread raven banner with a death wish that defies all who stand in his path. If you've ever wanted to play a warrior with a dark destiny crawling from behind and even as it drives him onwards to meet his fate for death or glory, pick up this 38-page Pathfinder character class supplement today and Make Your Game Legendary!

221453.name: Encounters at Gormell
221453.description:
From publisher blurb:

PL1 – Encounters at Gormell is the initial adventure for the campaign in the Principality of Lockerbie. This series of adventures are set in the land known for the large city of Kettlespit and the capital of Xado Keep. The land resides to the south of the mountain range called the Spines, home to a devastating series of magic wars years ago. This land was the site of many battles and skirmishes and the western reaches are still very dangerous. This offering provides information on the village of Gormell and a variety of different scenarios to get your first level players up to second level and beyond!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a 4-6 adventurers of 1st level and a DM.

221454.name: Beasts of Bright Mountain
221454.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Whispers Conclude!

The heroes have driven away the ogre army attacking Brighton. All that remains to defeat the Cult of Shub-Niggurath is to confront a transformed Corvun Baerg and his Witch master Hexos Vell-The Skinless One!

After the party travels through miles of tunnels, they discover a fertile valley and the entrance to the secret temple of the Ebon dawn cult. But before they enter the ancient place, they are attacked by legendary Beast of Bright Mountain.

Will the demonic entity succeed in stalking and assassinating the heroes one-by-one? Or will they thwart the mythical monster in time to stop The Skinless One?

Beasts of Bright Mountain is the conclusion of the Whispers of the Dark Mother Adventure Path. A Level 6 adventure for 4-5 players.

Also included: an overview of the faith of The Creator, Celmae’s God of Nature.

221455.name: Perils of the Endless Megadungeon: Series I - Dungeon Complex
221455.description:
From publisher blurb:

A themed collection of 24 full-color high resolution (300 dpi) interconnecting geomorphic maps for your virtual tabletop (VTT) role-playing games.

Series I Theme: Dungeon Complex (see preview for examples).

20 large geomorphic dungeon maps that can be rotated, flipped, or mirrored and still connect.
4 additional geomorphic “edge” maps to cap off the boundaries of your mega dungeon.
All 24 map files are provided in 300 dpi JPG format (sized: 3072 x 3072 px)

221456.name: Perils of the Endless Megadungeon: Series II - Caverns
221456.description:
From publisher blurb:

A themed collection of 24 full-color high resolution (300 dpi) interconnecting geomorphic maps for your virtual tabletop (VTT) role-playing games.

Series II Theme: Caverns (see preview for examples).

20 large geomorphic cavern maps that can be rotated, flipped, or mirrored and still connect.
4 additional geomorphic “edge” maps to cap off the boundaries of your caverns.
1 Bonus map to link Series II Caverns with Series I Dungeon Complex
All 25 map files are provided in 300 dpi JPG format (sized: 3072 x 3072 px)

221457.name: Perils of the Mysterious Lost Lands: Series III - Landmasses
221457.description:
From publisher blurb:

A themed collection of 24 full-color high resolution (300 dpi) maps for your virtual tabletop (VTT) role-playing games.

Series III Theme: Landmasses (see preview for examples).

24 landmass maps that can be rotated or mirrored.
All 24 map files are provided in 300 dpi JPG format (sized: 3072 x 3072 px)

221458.name: Neverthirst Oasis
221458.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue of Cartographer’s Cache features a map of a desert oasis in a fantasy setting. The scene is further set by a deep chasm and rope bridge, a ruined structure (abandoned oasis waystation), and the submerged skeleton of an aquatic megafauna.

Both daytime and nighttime themes are included. Versions of maps include gridded & labeled, gridded & non-labeled, and non-gridded and non-labeled (perfect for virtual tabletop gaming).

221459.name: Belly of the Behemoth
221459.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue of Cartographer’s Cache features a map of a grotesque dungeon that is actually the stomachs of a gigantic living monster.

Versions of maps include gridded & labeled, gridded & non-labeled, and non-gridded and non-labeled (perfect for virtual tabletop gaming).

221460.name: Evening Session Map Set #18
221460.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you need an encounter map on the fly?

Have Your players turned left instead right (again!)?

Do You want to run a quick game for your friends in the evening and looking for inspiration?

If you answered yes for one (or more) of these questions, The Forge Studios has released a product that suits your needs.

Evening Session Map provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting encounter or one shot adventure for one evening play. Each product in the line consists of notebook for a GM and handouts, which can be printed and presented to players.

'Evening Session Map #18' consists of maps and handouts of ruined city.

The set consists of:

a perspective drawing of the ruined city;
ruined city map
two smaple ruined buildings

221461.name: Alien Evolution: Racial Mutations
221461.description:
From publisher blurb:

Alien Evolution takes the concepts of Traits and creates a system for you to quickly add strange and unusual features to any race and create diverse species. Antennae on humans, blue-skinned elves, and tentacle dwarves are just a few ways this system can add diversity on the fly as your players travel a multitude of strange worlds.

This system is also perfect for players to create new racial variations without having to create entirely new races or finding one that fits their ideas, and allows them to do it quickly! Players may choose up to two of these Evolution traits (or mix and match with standard traits)or choose a drawback to receive a third Evolution trait.All races are free to choose Evolution Traits.

221462.name: Ladders to Learning: Balloon Game
221462.description:
User Summary
Quiz game in a boardgame style for up to four players: Each player have a hot air balloon that they should move from one side of the screen to the other (15 spaces).

The player spins to get a number which they will move if they guess correct in the following question.

First to get to the other side wins the game.

One of many games in the Ladders to Learning series, also called Balloon Race

221463.name: Ladders to Learning: Growing Green
221463.description:
User Summary
Quiz game.
Up to four players move from a tree's roots to it's branches (14 spaces) by answering correct on questions. First to the top wins the game.

221464.name: Invasion of Norway 1940
221464.description:
'User Summary' Invasion of Norway 1940 is a turn based strategy game set in Norway during the Second World War. Set during the German invasion of Norway in 1940 the Germans must use air, naval, and ground units to subdue Norway. Created by Joni Nuutinen as part of the Conflict-Series.

The player commands the German forces in the invasion of Norway. The AI commands the Allied forces. The Each unit can move between 0 and 3 spaces per turn. Moving into an enemy space causes combat. Supplying your units can be challenging with the arrival of the British navy.

A game sure to please any wargamer.

221465.name: Kobold Chaos
221465.description:
From the introduction:

The[...]ancient copper mines of Minstoria, located near the small town of Narath, have long since run dry and [been] abandoned. There have been several reports of undead in the mines since it closed down and, as a result, the villages keep their distance.

User summary:

For 1st level characters.

221466.name: Shadow Out of Sapphire Lake (S&W)
221466.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a distant extraplanar prison, the outer power Ibholtheg thrashes and reels, sending tremors into the Prime Plane. Those tremors are causing a split to appear between the planes, and from that gulf Ibholtheg stretches its influence out, attempting to widen it. Shadows lengthen in the nearby frontier town of Kraden’s Hill, but is it too late to stop the return of the once-powerful Squamous Toad?

TG3 Shadow Out of Sapphire Lake is the third and final adventure in the Fantasy Renaissance Adventure Module series MEMORIES OF THE TOAD GOD. It is designed for a party of four to six characters, levels 4 to 6. The GM should read the module thoroughly before playing to become familiar with the overall plot of the adventure.

221467.name: Shadow Out of Sapphire Lake (Savage Worlds)
221467.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a distant extraplanar prison, the outer power Ibholtheg thrashes and reels, sending tremors into the Prime Plane. Those tremors are causing a split to appear between the planes, and from that gulf Ibholtheg stretches its influence out, attempting to widen it. Shadows lengthen in the nearby frontier town of Kraden’s Hill, but is it too late to stop the return of the once-powerful Squamous Toad?

TG3 Shadow Out of Sapphire Lake is the third and final adventure in the Fantasy Renaissance Adventure Module series MEMORIES OF THE TOAD GOD. It is designed for a party of four to six Seasoned characters. The GM should read the module thoroughly before playing to become familiar with the overall plot of the adventure.

221468.name: Shadow Out of Sapphire Lake (5E)
221468.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a distant extraplanar prison, the outer power Ibholtheg thrashes and reels, sending tremors into the Prime Plane. Those tremors are causing a split to appear between the planes, and from that gulf Ibholtheg stretches its influence out, attempting to widen it. Shadows lengthen in the nearby frontier town of Kraden’s Hill, but is it too late to stop the return of the once-powerful Squamous Toad?

TG3 Shadow Out of Sapphire Lake is the third adventure in the Fantasy Renaissance Adventure Module series MEMORIES OF THE TOAD GOD. It is designed for a party of four to six characters, levels 4 to 6. The GM should read the module thoroughly before playing to become familiar with the overall plot of the adventure.

221469.name: Shadow Out of Sapphire Lake (Pathfinder)
221469.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a distant extraplanar prison, the outer power Ibholtheg thrashes and reels, sending tremors into the Prime Plane. Those tremors are causing a split to appear between the planes, and from that gulf Ibholtheg stretches its influence out, attempting to widen it. Shadows lengthen in the nearby frontier town of Kraden’s Hill, but is it too late to stop the return of the once-powerful Squamous Toad?

TG3 Shadow Out of Sapphire Lake is the third and final adventure in the Fantasy Renaissance Adventure Module series MEMORIES OF THE TOAD GOD. It is designed for a party of four to six characters, levels 4 to 6. The GM should read the module thoroughly before playing to become familiar with the overall plot of the adventure.

221470.name: Shadow Out of Sapphire Lake (DCC)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
221470.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a distant extraplanar prison, the outer power Ibholtheg thrashes and reels, sending tremors into the Prime Plane. Those tremors are causing a split to appear between the planes, and from that gulf Ibholtheg stretches its influence out, attempting to widen it. Shadows lengthen in the nearby frontier town of Kraden’s Hill, but is it too late to stop the return of the once-powerful Squamous Toad?

TG3 Shadow Out of Sapphire Lake is the third and final adventure in the Fantasy Renaissance Adventure Module series MEMORIES OF THE TOAD GOD. It is designed for a party of four to six characters, levels 2 or 3. The GM should read the module thoroughly before playing to become familiar with the overall plot of the adventure.

221471.name: Shadow Out of Sapphire Lake (C&C)
221471.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a distant extraplanar prison, the outer power Ibholtheg thrashes and reels, sending tremors into the Prime Plane. Those tremors are causing a split to appear between the planes, and from that gulf Ibholtheg stretches its influence out, attempting to widen it. Shadows lengthen in the nearby frontier town of Kraden’s Hill, but is it too late to stop the return of the once-powerful Squamous Toad?

TG3 Shadow Out of Sapphire Lake is the third and final adventure in the Fantasy Renaissance Adventure Module series MEMORIES OF THE TOAD GOD. It is designed for a party of four to six characters, levels 4 to 6. The GM should read the module thoroughly before playing to become familiar with the overall plot of the adventure.

221473.name: Carder Harmonies: A Set Building Card Game From La Dispute
221473.description:
La Dispute is enlisting your help in coming up with the ideal setlist. Mirroring the way the band builds performance sets in real life, you'll arrange themed subsections (called Blocks), using the right songs in the right combinations to earn the most Applause Points. However, Broken Strings and Technical Difficulties might disrupt your plans...

Carder Harmonies is a card game for 1-3 players (competitive or collaborative mode available for multiplayer games). Using various Song cards covering the entire discography of the post-hardcore band La Dispute, players use their hand of 3 cards to populate Set Blocks with Songs, abiding of course by that Block's special conditions (a variety of song counts, allowing songs of only certain records, or heavy/soft dynamics). When a Block condition is met, that Block becomes closed and those songs are safe from the banes of Technical Difficulties, Broken Strings, and other immediate action cards in the deck.

New to the game in 2nd edition are Block Modifiers, a type of card to add additional restrictions to a single block, granting bonus applause at the end of the game for achieving the listed goal or costing you the same amount upon failure.

Once all their Set Blocks are closed, players then tally their Applause Points, accounting for a Song's individual worth, any special conditions granting bonus points, and a streak of consecutive Songs from the same record. Solitaire players aim to surpass a given Applause threshold for their chosen difficulty level, while 2 player mode has the players aiming to score higher than their opponent.

221474.name: Support
221474.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everybody Loves the Healer

There is battle, and then there is warfare. Many adventurers are familiar with wading into combat against monsters and small groups of enemies, but this is nothing next to the glory and chaos and carnage that is true war. More than simply a change in scale, the difference between war and other combat can be profound. In a war, the characters are part of something larger than themselves, contributing to the efforts of their armies, or perhaps leading those armies themselves. The priorities of a soldier are different from those of an adventurer, and often the challenges that they face are, as well. While many characters can translate their talents as adventurers to the battlefield, one who specifically focuses on warfare and battlefield tactics will have the edge on others when it comes to true war. Each installment of Weekly Wonders: Archetypes of War provides six new war-themed archetypes for a variety of classes.

For this book, we focus on support, the unsung heroes of every army whose role it is to keep their allies going in the face of long marches, low morale, and, of course, overwhelming odds. Whether it’s healing wounds, inspiring allies to perform at their best, or unlocking powers they never knew they had, the characters in this book may not hound the glory, but they are nonetheless vital to ensuring the group makes it through any trial. This book contains the following archetypes.

The allycaster, an arcanist archetype that is able to cast spells far more effectively on her allies.
The occult tactician, an occultist archetype that can invest focus in allies, as well as objects.
The devious assistant, a rogue archetype that can protect nearby allies from area effects, and even allow allies to make sneak attacks.
The battle poet, a skald archetype that can inspire his allies to great heights, and even imbue them with magical power.
The new subdomains ally, care, friend, and shelter.
A bonus archetype for the mystic, from Path of War Expanded by Dreamscarred Press, the glyphwarder can heal her allies and create special glyphs to empower them.

221475.name: Heroic Rings
221475.description:
From publisher blurb:

Seven Rings of Power are coming, (don't get too excited, dwarves...)

Saturday morning cartoons and comic books from the drugstore contained mysterious 'rings of power' to give their heroes the might to fight for right!
In the new Purple Duck Storeroom you can see seven of these mystical pieces of jewelry come to life! In Jacob Blackmon's Heroic Rings you will find the Ring of the Sage Sentinel, the Decoder Ring, the Grimm Ring and the Jungle Ring, the soaring Signet Ring of the Legion Aeris, the powerful Twin Rings of Wonder, and the Wardrobe Ring for those quick changes! Collect all seven and you may win a prize... just kidding. But you will be powerful beyond imagining if you get Purple Duck Storeroom: Heroic Rings from the jaunty jewelers at Purple Duck Games, where our games are what you want!

221476.name: The Monster's Arsenal
221476.description:
A Trove of Monster Options

From the introduction:

With Fifth Edition, monsters underwent simplification and streamlining to make combat encounters faster, smoother, and more enjoyable. Although monsters in the current edition work beautifully, there are times when I miss some of the monster powers and capabilities offered in the previous edition.

This book, the Monster Arsenal, draws inspiration from those Fourth Edition monster powers.

User summary:

A collection of powers and modifications for 5th Edition standard monsters.

221477.name: Planet Archipelago Basic Game Rules
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221477.description:
From publisher blurb:

The basic rule for a table top role play game set on the alien planet "Archipelago" in the future. Players can explore, settle new islands, fight terrible creature and make money by commence, or adventure.There is no magic or occult in the game. It is basic human skills against an alien world.

221478.name: Flora & Fauna of Planet Archipelago
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221478.description:
From publisher blurb:

A collection of the alien plants and animals that inhabit the Planet of Archipelago. This is a valuable resource in designing your own adventures on the planet.

221479.name: The Shipbuilders of Planet Archipelago
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221479.description:
From publisher blurb:

A supplimental collection of more than 30 readymade ships and boats plus the rules for designing your own ship for use in the game Planet Archipelago. A great addition for anyone play the game.

221480.name: Non-Player Characters for Planet Archipelago
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221480.description:
From publisher blurb:

A supplimental collection of more than 30 readymade ships and boats plus the rules for designing your own ship for use in the game Planet Archipelago. A great addition for anyone play the game.

221481.name: Jacob's Isle Atlas Section for Planet Archipelago
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221481.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jacob's Isle Atlas Section for Planet Archipelago or the seas just east of the falcon Empire. This is a collection of maps and pictures of islands and their communities that allows players and Gamemasters to plan they adventures and routes. It includes material about the Quillian a native race on the planet and the Ferlie another race that had come to the planet centuries before the humans came.

221482.name: Table Isle Atlas Section for Planet Archipelago
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221482.description:
From publisher blurb:

A collection of maps and pictures of the islands in the Table Isle section. The islands northeast of the falcon Empire and north of the Jacob's Isle atlas section. Includes towns and cities, and basic information about each island.

221483.name: Fallen Dome & Aruth Section for Planet Archipelago
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221483.description:
From publisher blurb:

This atlas section includes the area just north of the falcon Empire and west of the table isle section. It includes towns and cities and the general political and geographic material about each island.

221484.name: Isle d' France Section for Planet Archipelago
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221484.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Atlas section for Planet Archipelago covers the islands and seas west of the Aruth & Fallen Dome Section. It includes two uncharted islands plus details on the know charted islands of this section.

221485.name: Isle d' Joc Section for Planet Archipelago
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221485.description:
From publisher blurb:

This atlas Section covers nine islands and the surrounding seas. it is the area just west of the growing Falcon Empire. This area is briefly discribed in the basic rules book. The Atlas gives more details of the area and its people.

221486.name: Ost Front 3
221486.description: Lone Canuck Publishing extends its Ost Front series with the third ASL expansion adding another 6 scenarios to the series. This time the scenarios are focused around "The German Invasion of the Soviet Union, 22 June 1941."

221487.name: The University at Deeport Falcon Empire
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221487.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Suppliment for the game Planet Archipelago covers skills that can be aquired by a player character by attending the university in the Falcon Empire seaport of Deeport. It provides material for a gamemaster to run a mini skill learning adventure for new player characters.

221488.name: NPC Leaders & Characters of Aruth & Fallen Dome on Planet Archipelago
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221488.description:
From publisher blurb:

A collection of twelve leaders and personalities who shape the politics and policies of the islands of Aruth and Fallen Dome a great suppliment for any Gamemaster running a Planet Archielago adventure.

221489.name: The Duarf of Planet Archipelago
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221489.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Material is designed for a Gamemaster and should not be read by the players in a game. It gives details about the Duarf and their culture for use by the gamemaster as they design adventures on the planet Archipelago. In cluded are some Duarf NPC leaders who influence Duarf-Human interaction.

221490.name: The Falcon Empire of Planet Archipelago Atlas
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221490.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Atlas section covers the islands of the Falcon Empire's home waters. A great resource for both players and gamemasters. 87 pages of maps and pictures with details on Falcon Empire leadership and attitudes. the cities and landscape of the Empires home islands.

221491.name: Antonio & Sons Marine Salvage
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221491.description:
From publisher blurb:

A marine salvage company for use as NPC players or as an employer for an adventure with player characters working to salvage a sunken treasure.

221492.name: Crime & Punishment on Planet Archipelago
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221492.description:
From publisher blurb:

So your player characters broke the law and got caught. This is what will happen to them on most human contolled islands on Planet Archipelago. This suppliment includes the floorplan of a small prison, Three NPC prison guards and pictures to illustrate the punishment system.

221493.name: Ryan's Rat Hounds: A Mercenary Army for Hire
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221493.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need some mercenaries for your game? Hire Rayn's Rat Hounds. A mercenary army and navy for hire. Two new ship types, and siege artillery encluded. NPC for The Baron O'Ryan and his field commander included. maps of Ryan's isle and its three towns are also included.

221494.name: The Quillian of Planet Archipelago
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221494.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a gamemasters suppliment with material about the native race called the Quillian. It gives their language, customs, ships, habits, religion and includes some Quillian NPC for use in any adventure.

221495.name: The Last Voyage of the Falcon Naval Ship Sibilla
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221495.description:
From publisher blurb:

A search for a lost treasure ship. This adventure unit gives the setting and NPC characters for a gamemaster to use in a treasure hunt. This Unit has a very high chance of combat between not just creatures but both pirates and Falcon naval forces.

221496.name: The Caves at Fisherman's Rocks
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221496.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an adventure unit for Planet Archipelago. The material is for the use of a gamemaster in guiding the players and their characters through an adventure searching for hidden pearls. This is a good begining adventure and can be played in an single afternoon.

221497.name: Bushido: Shuichi
221497.description:
The Takashi clan have long followed the teachings of Michi and unlike some of the other clans in the Jwar Isles strictly adhere to its teachings when raising the next generation. The Michi priests already offer the support of their military arm in the form of the Seishin na Geoi, but are not opposed to accompanying any believes on their paths, whether that leads them to battle or otherwise. Through years of dedication the Michi priests are able to evoke the protective powers of their ancestors, dousing flame, neutralising poisons or the intrusive commands of others. The presence of the spirits can also be used to distract and block the concentration of enemies.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

221498.name: Cameron's Isle
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221498.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an Adventure unit for the game Planet Archipelago it should only be read by the gamemaster who plans to use the material in a game. The island is tropical and in the atlas it is located in the falcon Empire sector. However a gamemaster may place the island in any tropical zone his players are operating in.

221499.name: Papyrus Wanted
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221499.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for newer players which can be played in a single game session. harwork in a sorfly swamp can pay off good if you need extra cash. This material is designed for use by the gamemaster in guiding the player characters through an adventure.

221500.name: The Sea of Grass
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221500.description:
From publisher blurb:

Totally rewritten the Sea of Grass is an opportunity to explore a maze of watery passageway through a sea of grass in search of a lost treasure.This adventure unit is for use by a gamemaster in guiding the player characters through the adventure. This adventure might require two gaming sessions. Depending on the actions of the player characters. This adventure may, depending on the players choices,require experienced combat against the Quillian, a very dangerous foe.

221001.name: ReadWriteRoll
221001.description:
Publisher's blurb:

ReadWriteRoll is a system for readers, writers, and roleplayers who love telling stories with friends! It combines familiar d20-style mechanics with story game sensibilities to create a simple system designed around the way stories are constructed.

The core mechanic is simple - roll a d20, add modifiers, and determine if the total is high or low, even or odd. If the total is high, you succeed! If it's low, you fail. If the total is an even number, you narrate your success or failure. If the total is odd, the gamemaster or your opponent gets to describe you success or failure.

The game also uses risk dice, polyhedrals from a d4 to d12 that allow you to influence your level of success or failure. The bigger the die type, the bigger the risk. The bigger the risk, the greater your possible success - and the larger the consequences for failure!

ReadWriteRoll is divided into three sections:


The first helps you to determine the type of story you want to tell, and allows the gamemaster to put together a setting alone or collaboratively with the rest of the group.
The second section is character creation, so you can create the protagonists, antagonists, and supporting cast needed to populate your story!
The final section contains the rules, everything you need to play the game and tell your story!

221002.name: A Scandal in Bohemia
221002.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Scandal in Bohemia (A Study in Storytelling #1) helps you to deconstruct the original story by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. You can then reimagine, remix, and recycle the story elements into any genre or setting. Designed for writers and roleplayers, use it to create original fiction or tabletop adventures!

Read the original story, included here. Then with clear step-by-step instructions, you can:


Determine the goals and stakes of your Sherlockian adaptation
Work out the beginning, middle, and end of your version of the mystery
Know the locations, characters, and other elements you need to create


A Scandal in Bohemia is volume 1 of the A Study in Storytelling series. It was designed to work with ReadWriteRoll, but is system-agnostic and can be used alone.

221003.name: The Red-Headed League
221003.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Red-Headed League (A Study in Storytelling #2) helps you to deconstruct the original story by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. You can then reimagine, remix, and recycle the story elements into any genre or setting. Designed for writers and roleplayers, use it to create original fiction or tabletop adventures!

Read the original story, included here. Then with clear step-by-step instructions, you can:


Determine the goals and stakes of your Sherlockian adaptation
Work out the beginning, middle, and end of your version of the mystery
Know the locations, characters, and other elements you need to create


The Red-Headed League is volume 2 of the A Study in Storytelling series. It was designed to work with ReadWriteRoll, but is system-agnostic and can be used alone.

221004.name: A Case of Identity
221004.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Case of Identity (A Study in Storytelling #3) helps you to deconstruct the original story by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. You can then reimagine, remix, and recycle the story elements into any genre or setting. Designed for writers and roleplayers, use it to create original fiction or tabletop adventures!

Read the original story, included here. Then with clear step-by-step instructions, you can:


Determine the goals and stakes of your Sherlockian adaptation
Work out the beginning, middle, and end of your version of the mystery
Know the locations, characters, and other elements you need to create


A Case of Identity is volume 3 of the A Study in Storytelling series. It was designed to work with ReadWriteRoll, but is system-agnostic and can be used alone.

221005.description:
These character meeples can be used to replace the cards that are included with Codenames. These character meeples are approximately 19 mm tall (Mega meeple) and have detailed designs painted on them, according to each role/color in the game:

(8) Blue Agent
(8) Red Agent
(7) Bystander
(1) Assassin
221005.name: Codenames: Character Meeples

221007.description:
Near and Far comes with cardboard standees. These character meeples are intended to be used in place of the standees that come in the game box.

Character meeples exist for each of the original 8 characters:
- Eyim
- Riza
- Tanian
- Kiku
- Vera
- Shardling
- Rin
- Grear
221007.name: Near and Far: Character Meeples

221008.description:
These character meeples can be used to replace the plain meeples that are included with Targi and its expansion. These character meeples are approximately 19 mm tall (Mega meeple) and have detailed designs painted on them, according to each role/color in the game:

(3) Blue Targi
(3) White Targi
(1) Robber (grey)
(1) Targia (purple)
221008.name: Targi: Character Meeples

221009.description: Stone Age comes with meeples in four different player colors (blue, green, red, and yellow). The expansion in includes meeples in black. These character meeples are intended to be used in place of the meeples that come in the game box. Instead of using a basic meeple corresponding to the player's color, these meeples have (5) male and (5) female replacements.
221009.name: Stone Age: Character Meeples

221010.name: Farewell to Foie Gras
221010.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Farewell to Foie Gras: Selected Logs in a Traveler’s Discoveries of Food and Drink across Arduise, Grand Culinary Traditions to Salve your Mind, Soul, and Body is a setting supplement for Farewell to Fear. Within its pages, you'll find thirteen recipes for both the fantasy world of Farewell to Fear, and for the real world. It's written in-character, exposing all sorts of interesting factoids and story hooks for your Farewell to Fear campaign, as well as offering real world cooking directions for each recipe.

221011.name: The GameMaster's Apprentice Instructions
221011.description:
From the introduction:

The GameMaster's Apprentice deck is a set of tools meant to be helpful for anyone running a roleplaying game. The randomizers on the cards aren’t linked to any particular game system, setting, or even genre.

The general purpose of this deck is to create and arbitrate the sort of story ideas and decisions often made by a GameMaster, but which can sometimes be randomized - perhaps to make the decision more "fair," or maybe just to help the GM come up with something totally new.

Each of the 120 card faces in this deck contains a set of fourteen randomizers. While each randomizer has a specific purpose for which it was designed, I did my best to make the cards as flexible as possible. How each randomizer, or the deck as a whole, is used depends entirely upon the needs of the group, Game Master, or player using them.

User summary:

This item contains general instructions and numerous pages of print-and-play components (cards) designed especially for use with ALONe.

221012.description:
These character meeples can be used to replace the plain meeples that are included with Colt Express and its expansion. Instead of using a basic meeple corresponding to the player's color, each player would use a character meeple corresponding to his/her hero.

- Tuco (red)
- Ghost (white)
- Samuel Ford (orange)
- Django (black)
- Cheyenne (lime green)
- Doc (light blue)
- Belle (pink)
- Shotgun (brown)
- Mei (yellow)
221012.name: Colt Express: Character Meeples

221013.name: Warhammer 40,000: Sanctus Reach – The Red Waaagh!
221013.description:
Description from the publisher:

This 112 page hardback book introduces the Sanctus Reach campaign fought on the Knight world of Alaric Prime. Inside you will find: Waaagh! Grukk, which is the story of the Red Waaagh! and its attack upon Alaric Prime. There are eleven scenarios that allow you to refight the battles of the Red Waaagh!

There is one Imperial Knight Formation datasheet, two Astra Militarum Formation datasheets and two Ork Formation datasheets.

Also adds rules to Warhammer 40,000 for Planetary invasions called Planetstrike and the Planetstrike mission: Planetfall.

221014.name: Redacted
221014.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Something's gone wrong, you're not etirely sure what it was, but it has affected the whole team. Will you work out the answers before everything falls apart?

An entire RPG (pretty crude, but enough to get you playing) in 200 words.

All that is required for play is a few dice, some pencils and some blank sheets of paper to write characters on.

Since the entire rule set is 200 words, it will require players who are both familar with the conventions of roleplaying games, and able to ad lib stories by feeding off one another's prompts.

221015.description: These horse tokens replace the plain horse tokens included in the Colt Express: Horse & Stagecoach expansion. These tokens have painted horse details to enrich your game playing experience.
221015.name: Colt Express: Horse Tokens

221016.name: Reliquary
221016.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Deep within a hidden stronghold, far from the mundane world, the powerful lord of the land has collected some of the most powerful relics in history. Each of these relics has shaped the destiny of nations, turned the tide of battles, and been present at pivotal moments of history. They are the most powerful artefacts of this world, each imbued with an immortal rune spirit, each getting bored with their decades of isolation in a hoard of gold. Rarely, a thief manages to penetrate the inner sanctum of the stronghold...

...this is one of those times, and the relics grow restless. They each reach out with eldritch powers and psychic penetration, trying to get the thief to steal them. They long to return to the outside world, once again to forge the destiny of the future.

221017.name: The Curse Of Yendor
221017.description:
User Summary

A sword and sorcery adventure.

221018.name: The Battle of the River Plate
221018.description:
The Battle of the River Plate is a tactical game of the December 13, 1939, engagement between the German cruiser Admiral Graf Spee and its British pursuers, the Ajax, Achilles, and Exeter. Components consist of a rules booklet, a Combat Card, four ship-armor diagram cards, plastic blocks labeled as the ships, wooden blocks in several colors, and eight dice.

The game is intended to be played on a hex board supplied by the owner. The rules specify use of an Avalon Hill Stalingrad board so that starting hexes can be specified in terms of Stalingrad locations. Pieces use both hexes and hexsides for movement to double the number of possible facing directions.

Movement is plotted and executed simultaneously. Rules cover gunfire, torpedoes, smokescreens, and ammunition supply. There is no time limit; play continues until the Graf Spee escapes or is sunk.

The stated purpose of the game is to "introduce the designers method of naval combat". Five years later Bruce Moore published the better known game Early Pacific Battles.

221019.name: Monopoly Junior: Eloise's Rawther Exciting Globetrotting Adventure
221019.description:
Description from the back of the box:

Join Eloise, Weenie, and Skipperdee on a globetrotting adventure around the world. You'll visit Eloise's favorite cities - Paris, Moscow, and of course New York, and learn lots of interesting facts about landmarks and famous places.

Along the way you can buy famous properties, put up penthouses and of course say "Charge It Please" when someone comes to visit.

The player who collects the most money at the end of the trip wins.

221021.name: InQuest Gamer (Issue 139 - Nov 2006)
221021.description:
On the Cover:
Johnny Depp vs. Captain Nemo: Deep-Sea Duel to the Death!

WORLD OF WARCRAFT TRADING CARD GAME!
The Deadliest Classes
The Best PVP Survival Tips
And the Secrets to Unlocking the Ultra-Rare Loot

Time Sprial: The Ultimate Guide
Hero Clix Supernove: Visual Guide

221022.description:
Recreation of a soccer game.
Teams are formed by 11 players.
Rules are simple.
Game for 2 players.
Field is divided into square areas.
There is a maximun number of players allowed per area.
Passes, driblings and shots to goal are checked by a die roll.
In advanced game there are action points for movement, an for dribbling.
221022.name: Telefoot

221023.name: InQuest Gamer (Issue 140 - Dec 2006)
221023.description:
On the Cover:
101 things every gamer must own!
Can you crack Magic's Da Vinci Code

221024.name: Little Rainbow Caterpillar
221024.description:
A multicolored collecting game for 2-4 players.

Each caterpillar has a headpart and a tailpart.
Shuffle up the 6 different colored bodyparts.
Roll the die and match the color of the visible bodypart.
If it match, add the bodypart to your caterpillar.
Or wait untill next turn.

Who can complete his caterpillar, with 6 different bodyparts, first and wins the game?

221025.name: The Battle of Midway 1942 AD: Independence Day
221025.description:
Independence Day Scenario : the following variant rules, and the accompanying counters, posit the Japanese launched their offensive a month later (July 3rd through 5th). Both sides would've been able to reinforce the forces used here, but would they have made a difference? Play the game with variants and find out!

Bonus scenario offered by Turning Point Simulation (for TPS's subscribers)

221027.name: Watch_Dogs 2 - Human Conditions
221027.description:
Includes three new stories set in San Francisco's science and medicine industries. The pack also includes new co-op missions starring the Jammer, a technologically savvy enemy capable of hunting players down.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Watch_Dogs_2%23Downloadable_content Watch Dogs 2]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

221029.name: Watch_Dogs 2 - No Compromise
221029.description:
User Summary

Players will experience an all-new world story which mixes Marcus up in the seedy underbelly of San Francisco and puts him in the crosshairs of the Russian mafia. Also includes a new co-op mode: Showd0wn, where only the best players will get to survive.

221030.name: Watch_Dogs 2 - Root Access
221030.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

Someone claiming to be the Zodiac Killer has returned to the Bay Area, and they’re leaving new messages from Marcus to uncover and decipher. In addition to the Zodiac Killer mission, this bundle includes new outfits, cars, a drone skin, and a new weapon.

This pack includes:
- The Zodiac Killer mission: a killer is staging the bodies of his victims all over Oakland and taunting the police like the infamous Zodiac Killer of the Sixties. Decrypt the messages and hunt down the copycat!
- Void Dasher car: this stealthy car will be harder for your enemies to detect.
- Peste Negra car: this gang car is optimized for sporty and well-balanced handling.
- Chameleon Copter decal: this furtive drone will help you complete your missions discreetly.
- Defalt Outfit: remember Defalt from Watch_Dogs? Wear a Defalt inspired outfit and show who's the boss!
- Protocol Pistol: This gold-plated powerhouse is a must-have for gangsters and dictators around the world. The Protocol Pistol will tell them who's boss.

221034.name: DunJon (Issue 22 - Jan 2017)
221034.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Perhaps the World's finest fantasy art and cosplay magazine.

DunJon Fantasy Femme Fatale eZine as it names suggests is fantasy art magazine that primarily focuses upon femme fatales. (Beautiful, yet dangerous women.) It is also a print collection. (All buyers of this pdf may print images for personal use.) It is also a Stock Art Catalog, all images in this and other DunJon eZines are up for sale. (Those who want to buy a professional license agreement may purchase HD images to make book/album/game covers, posters, and/or calendars see license agreement section of this eZine for pricing and options. )

This well-book marked, fantasy art eZine features images of beautiful women dressed in interesting, often sexy outfits in exotic locations doing amazing things. (Think Super heroines, Steam Punk Fatales, Tomb Raiders, Zombies Killers, Chain Mail Bikini Warriors, Vampires and more!) Other fantasy style images such as dragons, monsters, male heroes/villains, and otherwise interesting images have also been included. These images are presented in variety of styles, that include pure photography, Infrared photography, Surrealistic glow, and/or comic style dark lined impressionism.

This eZine contains dozens of printable 8.5x 11 images, plus bonus material to entertain and amaze you.

221035.name: DunJon (Issue 23 - Jan 2017)
221035.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Perhaps the World's finest fantasy art and cosplay magazine.

DunJon Fantasy Femme Fatale eZine as it names suggests is fantasy art magazine that primarily focuses upon femme fatales. (Beautiful, yet dangerous women.) It is also a print collection. This eZine contains dozens of printable 8.5x 11 images, plus bonus material to entertain and amaze you.

221041.name: CypherCaster Magazine (Issue 008 - Oct 2016)
221041.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The eighth issue of the CypherCaster Magazine includes:

We talk with Bruce Cordell about the Numenera Character Options 2 and cover two new Numenera adventure releases

An update on the new expansions to No Thank You, Evil!

Begin your first Trial of Champions in a new series by Michael Peters

We present a challenging multi-GM adventure The Idealizer by Dave Hanlon & Troy Pichelman

The Fade, a horror themed Numenera adventure by Skjalg Kreutzer

Our first Gods of the Fall adventure, Thirst by Marc Plourde

Check out a few new "Mundane Foci" by Paul Connolly

Scott Robinson helps you Extend and Customize horror themed games

Surprise your players with a slasher inspired horror tale "Prom night, Bloody Prom Night" by Rustin Coones

Discover a new way to present tomes of power in-game with Scott Robinson's "Players Guide to Ardeyn"

Our cover shows the final scene from Marc Plourde's Thirst where Gods of the Fall characters take on the powerful Matron Desolator, illustrated by Piotrek Antoniak

221043.description:
From the box:

From the Deep is a Lobotomy Board Game Expansion Set inspired by the dark and twisted novels of H.P. Lovecraft.

There is an ancient evil lurking in the basement of the mental hospital. The Deep Ones, an amphibious humanoid race, are preparing a ritual to call upon their deity. The only people aware of the danger are the patients of the asylum. Are they crazy or is Dagon the Great One really coming to destroy reality?

Find out with 5 game changing modules included in the expansion. Go deep with new miniatures: a new character Philip Howard, a horde of Deep Ones and the terrifying Father Dagon. Alter the gameplay with a set of small boards - the locations of challenging rituals. And finally get rewarded for saving the world by a deck of mysterious, powerful, beautifully drawn artifacts.
221043.name: Lobotomy: From the Deep

221045.name: Hell`s Little Story
221045.description:
User Summary

In the role of the young demon, you have to go through many of the most dangerous places.

221046.name: Barbarians & Basilisks
221046.description:
From publisher blurb:

Barbarians & Basilisks is a rules-lite romp inspired by bodacious barbarian movies.Take on the role of a barbarian, warrior, thief or sorcerer and battle everything from your everyday, garden-variety mutants and ogres to demons and basilisks. If you manage to survive, you can improve your skills for the inevitable sequel.

B&B requires only the rulebook, pencils, paper, two common, everyday dice (what we nerds sometimes call a d6) and a love of scantily clad swordplay. A sample adventure, Death-Slayer, is included to get you started on the path to big time barbarity!

Go ahead, tred on some thrones with those sandaled feet - you know you want to.

221047.name: Avalon Haunts 10
221047.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need something a bit scary for your game? Here’s Avalon Haunts! Each issue brings you a unique, fun, and creepy haunt to spice up your games. Drop the them just about anywhere, or build a whole game around the haunt! You will find them easy to use, fun to play, and having your games become creeping with scary fun.

This month we have another haunting tale to scare and thrill your players with.

221048.name: That Ye Be Not Judged
221048.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventurers unwittingly help a cleric accused of a crime escape justice.

That Ye Be Not Judged is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

221049.name: Peripheral Code: Writing in the Margins of Ars Magica (Issue 1 - Winter 2016)
rpgissue: Peripheral Code: Writing in the Margins of Ars Magica
221049.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Peripheral Code: Writing in the Margins of Ars Magica is a fanzine for the game Ars Magica, which is published by Atlas Games. This is the first issue!

Contents

Editorial: The Winter of Our Discontent
Atlas Games: An Update on "Magic Shoe" by Jeff Tidball
Wizard World: Playing Ars Magica with the Apocalypse Engine by Jared Hunt
Alternate Founders by Timothy Ferguson
Magi of the Order: the Flamboni Brothers
Fixing Automata by Jeremiah Wishon
Illuminations: The Folio of 1227
House Rules: Libraries
Athansius, the Last Librarian by James Seals
Submission Guidelines

221052.name: InQuest Gamer (Issue 144 - Apr 2007)
221052.description:
On the cover:
Horrorclix: The Movie
Scarlett Johansson is Razorvixen!

World Premier: World of Warcraft TCG
Through the Dark Portal

Fin Fang Boom: First look at HeroClix's Ultimate Dragon

221053.name: Hanafuda Hawaii Style
221053.description:
A variant of the traditional Japanese card game 'Hanafuda', this deck of cards is specifically designed for the Hawaiian Style game known as 'Sakura'. Two to six people can play, either individually or as teams of two.

The 48 cards are divided into twelve 'hiki' or suits, each corresponding to a specific month. The four cards in each hiki have 20, 10, 5, and zero points. The objective of the game is to accumulate the most points by matching cards. The highest possible score is 240 points.

After shuffling and cutting the deck, the 'oya' (dealer) deals cards counter-clockwise to the players; the number of cards dealt differs depending on the number of players. The oya then plays a number of cards in the center of the table, known as the "field". The remainder of the deck is set nearby as a draw stack.

Play begins with the oya and moves counter-clockwise. The player draws a card from her hand and places it in the field. If the played card matches the hiki (suit) of a card in the field, the player places her card on top of the matching card to show everyone the match. She then picks up both cards and places them face-up in a "points section" in front of her. She discards any cards with no value in the 'kasu' (rubbish) pile behind the draw stack.

Next, the player draws one card from the draw stack. If it matches a card in the field, she must take the pair of cards. Otherwise, the card is left in the field. This ends that player's turn. It is possible that a player may capture as many as four cards per turn.

The player to the right takes the next turn. Play continues in this fashion until all the cards have been used in each player's hand. Points are then totaled.

Advanced play adds a wild card and also 'yaku' (bonus combinations) in special three-card combinations that are scored at the end of the game. Holding one or more yaku causes the other players to deduct points from their score, rather than adding points to the yaku-player's score.

221054.name: TOSS: Tales of Significant Situations
221054.description:
From the introduction:

TOSS is a miniature framework for quick stories based on momentary events for a character in a roleplaying game. TOSS can work with any conventional tabletop RPG, but it shines in RPG’s that use skill checks for various actions.

TOSS was designed for use in places where conventional roleplaying is generally not feasible – at the bus stop, at a lunch break, or while watching commercials. It’s a way to create impromptu short stories on the fly. It can be used in a conventional tabletop setting, but is aimed for a solo player looking to add further stories to a favorite RPG or setting when there isn’t time for a whole session.

221055.name: Capella's Asylum
221055.description:
From the back of the book:

This large underground complex was made by the mad wizard Capella. The complex contains many special features and can be used in a variety of ways by mixing and matching maps, removing sections from the lair, or using maps individually.

Among the special features are:
- Five Maze Maps
- A Massive Pillar Level
- The Mines of Capella

The mines contain nine interconnected maps that cover the course of an underground stream and the surrounding mines.

221056.name: Four Things
221056.description:
From the introduction:

Four Things is a game for four people. It’s a simple game about ordinary people and examines the quirks and foibles which form our personalities and how we relate to each other.

Play this game with people you trust, who are willing to explore some emotional depths and have fun doing it.

To play you’ll need notecards or post its and sharpies.

221057.name: Spooky Four Things
221057.description:
From the introduction:

Sit in a circle, around a table is preferred as you will need to place things in the middle so everyone can see – light some candles, put on some spooky music, leave the back door unlocked.

221058.name: Codex: Unearthed Arcana
221058.description:
User Summary

The Codex: Unearthed Arcana is an unofficial collection of the official Unearthed Arcana released for D&D 5e.

It used to be updated regularly to contain all Arcana to date and is complete with credited sources and artwork. Due to copyright issues, further work and distribution of the Codex has been halted.

221059.name: Little Action
221059.description:
Description from the publisher (translated):
It's party time in the jungle! Build a pyramid, play skittles, throw and catch, ... .. take up these and many more little challenges to win medals. A first action game to get young children handling objects and developing their fine motor skills.

Preparing to play:
Place the six animals in the middle of the table next to base of the box and the medals. Shuffle the cards then place them in a pile face down next to the box.

How:
Players are entitled to three attempts for each challenge. The challenge is pointed out with a card.

If you succeed at a challenge, you win a medal, otherwise you do not win anything.

Who wins?
When all the medals have been won, the winner is the player with the most medals.

There are six challenges: As an example we will explain one challenge.

Challenge 1: The pyramid.
Take the two animals shown on the card and try to stack them
as illustrated in the picture. The pyramid needs to stay standing for at least 30 seconds in order to count.

Description from the publisher (translated):
¡Es la hora de la fiesta en la selva! Construir una pirámide, jugar a los bolos, lanzar y atrapar... Una serie de pequeños desafíos para ganar medallas. Un primer juego de acción, manipulación y destreza destinado a los más pequeños.

Preparación:
Se colocan los seis animales en el centro de la mesa junto a las medallas y el fondo de la caja. Se barajan las cartas y se apilan boca abajo junto a la caja.

Cómo:
Los jugadores pueden efectuar tres intentos para cumplir
cada desafío. Los retos están señalados en cada carta.
Si logra cumplir el desafío, el jugador gana una medalla. Si no, no gana nada. A continuación, le toca al jugador siguiente.
¿Quién gana?
Una vez distribuidas todas las medallas, gana el jugador que tiene la mayor cantidad.

Hay 6 desafíos. Como ejemplo explicamos el reto nº 1.
Desafío 1: la pirámide.
El jugador toma los dos animales de la carta e intenta superponerlos como se indica en ella. La pirámide debe mantenerse durante 30 segundos como mínimo para ser validada.

221060.name: InQuest Gamer (Issue 145 - May 2007)
221060.description:
On the Cover:
Halo vs. Star Wars: Which Game Will Conquer the Summer?

World Premiere! WoW TCG: Molten Core
Complete Dark Portal Strategy Guide

The New Face of Magic

221061.name: Magic Box
221061.description:
User Summary

Clicking on boxes with question marks causes the other boxes to fall. The goal is to make the blue arrowed boxes fall off and to keep the red exclamation boxes on the shelf. Sound easy? Unless some levels are added, this game can be over in 10-15 minutes.

221062.description:
Description from the back of the book:

This is one of the Late War Supplements for Flames of War. It is focused on the British attacks on Germany late March 1945 onward. It includes histories of the battles for the northern Rhine including Operation Plunder. Game options include rules to field a British Rifle Company, Armoured Squadron and the B Squadron, 15th/19th Hussars. Also are rules for fielding a Marine-Grenadier Kompanie, Panzerkampfgruppe Wallenberg and Panzerkampfgruppe von Benninsen.
This supplement features optional rules for fighting battles at night.
221062.name: Flames of War: Nachtjager

221063.name: The Crystal Planet: Player's Guide
221063.description:
From publisher blurb:

The World of Living Gems!

In the vast darkness of space, a glimmering jewel exists with equally stunning folk populating it.

Welcome to Scintilla -- The Crystal Planet -- home to a race of sentient gemstones called the mineralites. The Crystal Planet: Player’s Guide offers not only the full write up to play a race of intelligent gemstones with bodies composed of light and gravity, but an entire planet of adventure! Beam through space in streams of light, project holographic copies of yourself, or wield weapons grown from crystals that cut enemies to the quick. Unique mineralite spells grant an edge that organic foes lack and if that isn’t enough, your ability to fuse with others of your kind will turn you into a being greater than the sum of your parts!

The book includes a fully realized history, culture, and some unique technology for beings composed of jewels. Detailed within is a caste system that can literally define every aspect of a member’s life, career, and purpose -- or you can play as a rogue gem trying to break from the mold. Players will find a wealth of roleplaying options in The Crystal Planet: Player’s Guide for a range of playstyles. Alien yet all too familiar, these walking and talking gemstones can be the focus of a campaign or just a quirky side character, all with just this one book!

Included in The Crystal Planet: Player’s Guide are:

Write up on Scintilla, home planet of the Mineralites
Full race write up with castes and alternate racial traits
Four Class archetypes specific to mineralties
A mineralite sorcerer bloodline for anyone to use
Well over a dozen favored class options
28 new feats for use with Mineralites
23 new spells for spellcasting Mineralites
Roleplaying suggestions for playing a living gemstone
And much, much more!

221065.name: InQuest Gamer (Issue 146 - Jun 2007)
221065.description:
On the Cover:
Transformers Evolves!
The 3D game behind the summer blockbuster

Meg Magic Issue!
40 Page Blowout!
20 Devastating decks
10 Future Sight's best cards!
& The strangest card ever printed

221066.name: My Bloody Valentine
221066.description:
From the introduction:

Ah, Valentine's Day!You should be spending it with your sweetie, and flowers, and sunny meadows, and mrowrr... But there was the trouble with the thing with that stuff and now you're stuck having biscuits and a cuppa with your landlady. And it's worse than that ‐ she's making you talk to her other tenants. Trouble is, Miss Elisabeth is so nice, she'll let anyone in. They're nuts! How long before you're climbing the walls?

User summary:

The game is distributed as an archive with several folders and documents, including DOC and PDF documents and JPG images. Most of the documents are intended for print-and-play use.

221067.name: The Face of Oblivion
221067.description:
From the introduction:

This is a science fiction game of hard choices.

Disaster is coming. You can choose to save a massive amount of people whom you are formally responsible for, or a smaller group which includes everyone you ever loved and everything you ever cared about. There are no outs, no third options, only a few bare chances to mitigate (very slightly) the blow. You have two hours.

Go.

User summary:

The game is distributed as an archive including multiple documents and directories. Some documents are presented in both PDF and DOCX format; images are presented in JPG format. Most documents and images are intended for print-and-play use. The page count noted in this entry is a "best estimate" of pages with duplicate documents counted only once.

221068.name: Tesla's Wedding
221068.description:
From the Introduction:

Tesla’s Wedding is a giddy roleplaying game based on the steampunk genre, designed in a spirit of celebration and to evoke a feeling of joy. It is rules-light, has a range of characters from the intense to simple and lighthearted, and is suitable for introducing new players to LARPing, while giving old hands room to plot, scheme, and chew the scenery.

User summary:

The game is distributed in an archive containing numerous documents and directories. Documents are presented in PDF, XLS, DOC, and Text formats. Many documents are presented in two formats. Most documents are intended for print-and-play use. The page count noted in this entry is a best-estimate and does not count duplicate documents twice.

221069.name: PLANESS
boardgamepublisher: Board Game Parfait (ボードゲームパフェ)
221069.description:
User summary
PLANESS is a territory occupation game with a theme of space exploration.

There is a virtual square grid on the table, and each player places their space ship on the grid at the beginning of the game.

Each turn, your space ship moves several squares on the grid. For each square you passed, if it is unoccupied by any player, you place your planet chip on the square to indicate that this planet is yours. You may add mores chip on your planet by passing the same square again.

You may also pass an opponent's planet. In this case, the topmost chip on the square is removed, and if this make the square empty, you place your planet chip to indicate you have taken over the control of the planet.

Players count their victory points at the end of the game. You score big points if you have a large contiguous area of your planets. The highest scorer wins the game.

Publisher's summary
惑星探索をテーマにした陣取りゲーム。
ゲーム終了時に最も得点が高いプレイヤーの勝利。
自分の惑星を確保しつつ、相手の惑星を奪い、破壊することが勝利の鍵。
チーム戦も可能。

221070.name: Sorte Deck
221070.description:
From the Kickstarter description:

The sorte deck contains 78 cards (4 suits, 14 cards per suit + 22 Major Arcana). The perfect prop for any Théan courtier. (Especially fate witches!)

221071.name: What Came Before
221071.description:
Twenty-Five Fantasy Backgrounds

From the introduction:

The thing to remember with Backgrounds is that they are the past of a character, not the present. They let a player know what the character experienced before they became an adventurer. Thus it is possible to choose a cool background that no longer applies to the current character concept. Backgrounds dictate what a character was, not who they are.

221072.name: InQuest Gamer (Issue 149 - Sep 2007)
221072.description:
On the Cover:
Halo 'Clix Preview: First Look at Master Chief & More

WoW TCG: Fires of Outland: The Secrets of the 246 Card Set!

Special Report! Chutes and Ladders Deathmatch

221074.name: Text Twist
221074.description:
Based on an online word game, 'Text Twist' challenges players to make as many words as possible out of a given set of letters within a 2 minute period.

A game consists of 5 rounds. During each round, a card is drawn which lists a series of letters. Information is given on the card detailing how many possible 3,4,5,6 and 7 letter words can be created from that specific mix of letters. Players write the letters on their individual dry erase board, then the timer is flipped and players have 2 minutes to produce as many words as possible. At the end of the 2 minutes, players score points for valid words created (a booklet is included listing all possible words from each combination of letters). The score for that round is recorded, and the next round begins with a new set of letters. After 5 rounds, the player with the highest score wins.

The game can be played as a solo puzzle challenge.

Contents:
4 wipe-off Answer/Score boards
1 Instruction/Solutions booklet
144 cards (864 challenges!)
4 dry-erase markers
1 2-minute timer

221076.name: The Banner Saga 3
221076.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.




User Summary

The conclusion to the award-winning series of mature, story-driven, turn-based strategy games steeped in Viking culture.

221077.name: Pirate Nations
221077.description:
From the back of the book:

Let’s get the glad-rags on and drive her to sea For a free sailor’s life for sure it ain’t free

Piracy on the Seven Seas has reached a fever pitch. The black flag poses a constant danger for merchants and navies, as unscrupulous brigands seek their fortunes. But there are more dangers afoot than pirates: beasts lurking under the waves, rumors of haunted and immortal ghost ships…and the demon named “Reis.”

This book contains material for 7th Sea: Second Edition including new Backgrounds, Advantages, Stories and Sorceries. It also includes five new Pirate Nations:

Numa, the land where legends were born and never left
La Bucca, the once-prison island turned headquarters for international intrigue
The Atabean Islands, where the ghosts of Rahuri ancestors sail alongside native peoples
Aragosta, home of the Brotherhood of the Coast and a pirate paradise
Jaragua, self-liberated slave colony and home of a new Sorcery called Kap Sévi




Pirate Nations also includes new setting materials for 7th Sea featuring the Devil Jonah, the dreaded Reis and Théah’s first multinational, the Atabean Trading Company. There be adventure aplenty in these lands, more than any one crew can hope to see in a lifetime.

Sail, me hearties, and treasure what good luck you find. You’ll be needing it.

221078.name: Stock Trader: The Stock Market Board Game
221078.description:
Your rich uncle just gave you some investments. Can you make some smart moves and turn them into a fortune?

Stock Trader is a simple and fun stock market game that you can play solo or with the whole family. Do you have what it takes to be a smart investor on the stock exchange? Find out with Stock Trader, The Stock Market Board Game!

The objective of the game is to become the richest player by buying and selling stocks and gold. Buy low, and sell high!

The main board tracks the value of each investment. The value of each investment is increased or decreased by rolling dice each turn, if the positive die (green) is higher than the negative die (red), the value moves up that many spaces. If the red die is greater than the green die, the value drops and could even crash that stock completely! Each turn there is a new 'Headline News' card that can affect the stock values in addition to the dice rolls.

After the dice are rolled and the values set, each player decides what they would like to buy and sell and tracks their shares on their own 'Portfolio' card.

After 10-turns, everyone sells their investments and the player with the most money wins the game!

221080.name: Northern Regime
221080.description:
Northern Regime: 1862 is a hardcore survival game set against the backdrop of the American Civil War in the frozen and frigid lands of Northern Dakota. It’s you vs. the environment and all its inherent dangers as you tackle Confederate soldiers, hostile wildlife, and the cold to stay alive.

Source: The Game Website.

221081.name: Warhammer 40,000: Space Wolf
221081.description:
Warhammer 40,000: Space Wolf is a card-driven turn-based tactical game which features RPG elements, containing a single player campaign, survival and PvP modes. Win these battles using the arsenal of weapons, abilities and cunning of the sky warriors.

Source: The Developer Website.

221082.name: Dai Senka
221082.description:
Japanese children's 'wargame'. 1-4 players move from their starting spaces (2 as submarines, 2 as bombers) by die rolls, directed through a network of spaces by the number they roll, scoring points for the enemy ships they land on and 'sink'. With luck, one player can reach the victory space in the minimum of 5 moves.

The spaces in descending order are:
Victory:
大戦果 Dai Senka / Big Battlefield
60 points:
レキシントン USS Lexington (scuttled 8/5/1942, Battle of the Coral Sea)
プリンスオブウェールズ HMS Prince of Wales (sunk 10/12/1941, off Malaya)
25 points:
甲巡 heavy cruiser
甲巡エクゼター HMS Exeter (sunk 27/2/1942, Battle of Java Sea)
甲巡 heavy cruiser
15 points:
乙巡 light cruiser
乙巡トロンプ型 HNLMS Tromp (severely damaged, 19-20/2/1942, Battle of Bandung Strait)
乙巡デロイテル HNLMS De Ruyter (sunk 27/2/1942, Battle of Java Sea)
乙巡ジャバ型 HNLMS Java (sunk 27/2/1942, Battle of Java Sea)
15 points:
特巡 merchant raider
乙巡 light cruiser
輸送船 transport ship

221083.name: My Booty!
221083.description:
