My Booty! is a speed and dexterity game for 2 to 4 players. Each round, a set of lookout cards is revealed, then players must try to be the first to push forward the appropriate pirate tokens in front of them and slap on the treasure chest tile to score points.

Different lookout cards call for different pirate tokens. Act quickly, but don't twist your brain! Be the best and fastest pirate on the sea and enjoy some chaotic fun!

221084.name: Figure & ground
221084.description:
City Development game

game-play
Each turn draw a map tile, and place it with others map tile(s). If the map tiles form a 2/3 circle, you can draw a extra map tile from supply.
Then for each circle you form, you can gain 1 building tiles.
You can change city cards by building tiles.

goal
Be the first player collect 3 city cards.

221085.name: The Mines of Wexham
221085.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The Mines of Wexham by the late Gerald D. Seypura is a classic Old School Adventure designed for use with Champions of ZED and all "clones" of the Original Game. Characters may use their own characters or Geralds pregens, in a race to follow the clues from an old map to find the lost silveron mines of the ancient Reman Empire, and return alive with proof. Simple right? This adventure - the last from one of the industries'veteran designers - is suitable for low to mid level characters and is certain to provide hours of fun!

221086.description:
Full faction add-on that adds the Spanish Armada to the core game of British Vs Pirates.
Originally this faction came with 25 Skill Cards, but after reaching a Social Goal the number was increased to 27 Skill Cards.

Includes:

7 Spanish Ship Cards
7 Spanish Ship Miniatures
5 Spanish Captain Cards
18 D6 Dice
27 unique Spanish Skill Cards
221086.name: British Vs Pirates: Spanish Armada Add-on

221087.description:
This add-on adds reinforcements for both the British and Pirates factions with more ships and captain cards.

Includes:

2 Pirate Ship Cards
2 Pirate Ship Miniatures
1 Pirate Captain Card





2 British Ship Cards
2 British Ship Miniatures
1 British Captain Card



12 D6 Dice
221087.name: British Vs Pirates: Reinforcements Add-on

221088.name: 8 Out Of 10 Cats
221088.description:
In 8 Out Of 10 Cats, players or teams take turns answering questions on opinion polls, surveys and statistics.

There are five different categories of questions, including "Poll with a Hole", "And the Winner Is ...", and "Pick of the Polls". Players roll a die in order to determine which kind of question they have to answer. Once a player or team has correctly answered ten questions, they have to successfully answer an "8 Out Of 10 Stats" card to win (and end) the game.

221089.name: Fursona Unleashed
221089.description:
From publisher blurb:

Anthros aren’t simply one species.

Instead, the term is an umbrella for a variety of mostly interfertile, highly adaptable and exuberant hominids with bestial traits and a partially animalistic appearance. Anthros hail from every corner of the Multiverse. Some Anthro bloodlines are products of science: genetic uplifts from animal stock, while others are creatures of parallel evolution on distant worlds, or mystical hybrids created by sorcery or divine intervention.

Regardless of their origins, Anthros marry the natural instincts and survival adaptations of the animal kingdom with the cunning and intellect of humanity.

Fursona Unleashed is a complete and comprehensive revamp of the most popular, D20-based furry character creation system ever written! Building furry heroes with Fursona Unleashed is quicker, easier and more flexible than ever before. A new character creation system reduces book-keeping, pares down a lot of unneeded rules text, and allows for deeper, multi-faceted anthropomorphic characters. Hybrid creatures, blending the traits of multiple animal species, are easier than ever to imagine.

Where the first edition of Fursona defined anthropomorphic characters by their Order (the species type they belonged to), Fursona Unleashed allows for a more modular character creation. Players choose a unique ability score package for their furry hero or heroine, based on its animal nature. Size is chosen similarly, allowing for everything from Tiny rodent rogues to Huge elephant clerics or blue whale astronauts perfectly adapted for the depths of space. Finally, the player chooses several Gifts of Nature for their anthro, the amount of which is determined by the anthro’s size. Disadvantages allow the acquisition of additional Gifts of Nature, while optional templates offer further opportunities for customization.

221090.name: Foxtail Hills - Goblin Caves
221090.description:
From publisher blurb:

It doesn't take long for you to track down the hideout of these goblins. A small stream exits the mouth of a cave, and as you follow the path in you find yourself right in the middle of a cave complex that has been modified by the goblins.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting a cave system being used as a hideout by goblins and bugbears. A concealed entrance, river, rickety bridge and waterfall are found alongside a chamber where wolves are chained up, the common room for a group of goblins and their prisoners, and the living area of the bandit leader where they keep their stolen goods.

221091.name: Dulwich (5E)
221091.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5e Compatible GM’s Resource supplement by John Bennett

The growing trade town of Dulwich looms over the Great Salt Mire in the Duchy of Ashlar. A veritable torrent of lumber from the nearby forest enriches its citizens’ coffers and emboldens the growing merchant class. Dulwich’s lord, Wido Gall, resists the merchants’ efforts to topple his rule while coveting the nearby village of Longbridge. Both sides seek support from the followers of Conn, hoping to sway the newly appointed and young high priestess. Meanwhile, adventurers flock to the town’s inns and taverns, preparing their own expeditions into the ruins hidden in the nearby Forest of Gray Spires.

221092.name: Dulwich (System Neutral Edition)
221092.description:
From publisher blurb:

A System Neutral Edition GM’s Resource supplement by John Bennett

The growing trade town of Dulwich looms over the Great Salt Mire in the Duchy of Ashlar. A veritable torrent of lumber from the nearby forest enriches its citizens’ coffers and emboldens the growing merchant class. Dulwich’s lord, Wido Gall, resists the merchants’ efforts to topple his rule while coveting the nearby village of Longbridge. Both sides seek support from the followers of Conn, hoping to sway the newly appointed and young high priestess. Meanwhile, adventurers flock to the town’s inns and taverns, preparing their own expeditions into the ruins hidden in the nearby Forest of Gray Spires.

221093.name: Druid Enclaves - New Druid Archetypes
221093.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #108 introduces four new druid archetypes, each based on a specific alignment aspect.

221094.name: Forbidden Fruits
221094.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Adventure for Expert Characters!

Trouble has come to the door of Bleak's Faste, a stronghold built to protect the common peoples living in and around the Dark Forest. Beastmen have stepped up their attacks, raiding the trails and roads in a relentless assault that has kept the stronghold's soldiers on the defensive. To make matters worse, the expected supplies from a nearby commune have yet to arrive; unless they come soon, the soldiers will become too hungry to keep the howling, cackling hordes at bay.

Forbidden Fruits explores the mortal peril that the growing darkness poses to even the most virtuous of people. Anyone can be warped into debauchery and madness when they dwell in lands on which the shadow falls. The group completes this adventure by stopping the corrupted communers, preventing further infestation, and delivering the needed goods to Bleak's Faste.

221095.name: Hybrid Class: Redeemer
221095.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Road to Redemption is a difficult one… Ask the Redeemer!

The priest intoned, “Gerana has willed it that the Stone of Hearts must be returned to the Great Library, Kothus, you do understand that?”

“Is that so?” said the black-cloaked man, who cocked his head, his mouth quirked in a smile beneath his unseen eyes.

“Was it not sold to the Nerians of Olthar for the price of several indiscreet prophecies, my Lord? A legal, if not an approved of. transaction by the late Pericodion Althus?”

The shaven priest reddened and said nothing. Kothus replied anyway,” Worry not, loan me a ranger and a wizard or two and it will be back in a fortnight. My Lord.”

The new Redeemer hybrid 20-level class from Purple Duck Games creates the unique combination of paladin (or antipaladin) and rogue, for a holy thief that obeys the will of his patron, to get the job done when no one else will do… Author Aaron Hollingsworth’s Hybrid Class: Redeemer from Purple Duck Games brings this intriguing class to life, describing the various reckonings (similar to inquisitor judgements) paladin-like auras, and roguish talents that this versatile class brings to the game. Alterative reckonings are available to make redeemer characters exactly what you want them to be!

221096.name: Autarcha
221096.description:
Join the dynamic action embedded in the turbulent times of World War II. The heroic struggle, full of sacrifices and tough decisions will make even you fail to notice how much you consume climate unpredictable clashes on the battlefield. Take on the role of an all-powerful commander and lead your troops on the way to victory.

Autarcha is an innovative strategy, which compete with each other two parties to the conflict. Rich in variants of tactical gameplay makes every time we experience a meeting with the game again. Enhanced combat system and countless possibilities are distinguishing features of the product. Trust us and let yourself be drawn into a new world of Autarcha.

The game takes place on the board, on which are marked various landscape elements: land, forest, mountains, rivers and cities. The board is perforated by transport links, such as road and rail. Each of these elements can be used in the game: Rail and road allow faster transport, forest and mountains hide the army and the cause that they are difficult to destroy, and the water stops, eg. Armor or artillery, which they can not overcome these obstacles. It depends on the player how to use elements of the board.

Most important is the general staff - in most scenarios, the destruction ensures victory. It represents the player and can give orders to the other four types of units:

Infantry - cheap unit with a relatively small range. Easy to recruit and rapid implementation to fight.
Sappers - a specialized unit performing special operations, eg. Putting min, which in turn are invisible to the enemy
Panzer - unit with a high cost, but high mobility in the field and long range.
Artillery - a unit of positional far, code coverage.
Branches can attack at a distance in their moves during the turn.

The game is included economic aspect, each player can build infantry and sappers in the city and armored units and artillery in our factory.

The game can be started in a simple way - choose the same set of units for each player, set them on the board and start the fight.

221097.name: #30 Firearms of Legacy
221097.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Don’t your heroes deserve firearms that can advance with them?

The valiant are known by the weapons they wield—Excalibur, Mjolnir, Narsil, The Mexican, Dead Man's Gun—all weapons that carry meaning and power into the hearts of foes simply by uttering their names. What weapon will your hero carry into legend?

With #30 Weapons of Legacy, you’ll have plenty to choose from, whether you’re an pistol wileding gunslinger, a pyromaniac alchemist, or a monk who practices gun-fu. Use the armor shattering Aegisbane, the assassian's friend and piston known as Deadeyes’ Whisper, or the necromantic blunderbuss Grinder that uses the bones of its fallen foes as ammunition. Each one of these legacy items includes physical descriptions, omens, lore, 5 special abilities, and their method of destruction.

Check out free preview and/or get yours today!

221098.name: Hollywood Blvd.
221098.description: Players are theater owners on Hollywood Boulevard tasked with picking films that will generate more money than any of their competitors. Each turn represent one week wherein films will be played. Each film will generate money by rolling dice. The more dice, usually the more money. There are various methods of gaining more dice for the films. Advertising, studio deals, etc will adjust these values.

221099.name: #30 Manuals of Improvement
221099.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"It’s a bit more than a self-help book!"
More than knowledge lies within these pages, waiting within lies talent.

Within you will find grimoires such a “Break Anything!” that can imbue a gift for sabotage; “Drawing from the Divine” a book that enhances one’s ability to channel energy; and “Fistful of Power” teaches you the arts of unarmed combat.

Get more than just information, go beyond your limitations with #30 Manuals of Improvement!

221100.name: Oh Shit! The Excremely Fun Game!
221100.description:
Make poo great again! See the exclusive Golden Poo on the kickstarter page! We have also 2 unicorn poo in the game that will help to avoid constipation and suffering to death!

Oh Shit! is a simple and really fun card game where you need to prevent stacking 5 poo cards. You can flush them with a toilet or making a 3 color match on your pile. A suppository will remove only the top card and cancel the constipation.

Anyone can play and it is really fun to fill other players with poo!

221101.name: Skeeing
221101.description:
This is a dexterity game with an unusual box. It is hinged on one side, and when opens, creates an extended lithographed playing field. The bottom of the box has a ramp starting at the hinge, and five scoring slots on the far side (worth 10, 20 and 50 points).

Players take turns shooting marbles from the top end, over the ski jump and (hopefully) into one of the scoring slots. Player with the highest total score for six marbles wins.

This game was produced by the German publisher Klee, but the box says "Made in Bavaria" and bears the company's early "Clover" international logo (Klee is German for Clover). While undated, this certainly means it was published after Moritz Bromeisl joined the company in 1915 and began moving it into international markets, and probably between the end of WWI and the early 1920s.

221102.name: Animals with Weapons
221102.description:
Description from the publisher:

A shark vs manatee? No contest. A shark with a pool cue vs manatee with a bazooka? Interesting... A couple of billion years ago, evolution (or whatever) invented animals. A couple of million years ago our pre-human ancestors invented weapons. A couple of minutes ago we gave the former access to the latter.

Animals with Weapons is a casual card game for 2-4 players. It develops the idea of the traditional trump-card game by incorporating two main decks (Animals and Weapons), along with a 'sub-deck' of Terrain cards, which are combined to make animal/weapon combos. This eliminates much of the repetition of traditional trump-card games and allows strong weapons to compensate for weak animals. A 'capture or loot' mechanic also removes the stalemate which so often develops in trump-card games.

132 cards, with 60 animals in each of the main decks, makes for 3600 combinations in the base game, with multiple game modes to broaden gameplay.

Designed to be played in under half an hour, AWW is quick, brutal and very silly.

221103.name: Churchill Checkers
221103.description:
This all-wood game was published in Canada in 1943, clearly cashing in on the popularity of the British wartime Prime Minister. The solid wood board shows a circle with 4 concentric rings divided by 10 radii. There is a centre space marked with a Crown, and each of the 41 resulting spaces has a hole into which a wooden peg can be placed. There is a hole in the side of the board stopped with a cork in which 20 pegs are stored.

Each player starts with 10 pegs, placed in the outer two rings of half the circle. The pegs start with a plain side up, and are marked with the player's colour (red or black) on the other end.

Players move alternately, either clockwise, counter-clockwise or toward the centre. As in normal checkers, they must jump over an opponent into a vacant space if able to do so. A piece moving or jumping into the Crown space at the centre flips into a King, which is then allowed to move and jump outward as well as inward. A piece in the Crown space is safe, and only a King can jump back into the Crown space and continue jumping.

Normally, a player wins be eliminating the opponent's pieces, but there also are rules for a "losing" game where the objective is to give away all your pieces or create a situation where you are unable to move.

While the rules show the publisher as London Novelty and Display Products, the box says it was manufactured by Robinson Industrial - Crafts Limited, also of London, Canada.

221104.name: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells IX (PRD)
221104.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells is a simple document that collects the sorcerer/wizard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 9th-level sorcerer/wizard spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

221105.name: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells IX (3PP)
221105.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells is a simple document that collects the sorcerer/wizard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 9th-level sorcerer/wizard spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

221106.name: Reportages
221106.description:
This is a French journalism-themed card game in which players try to collect sets of reporters, stories and documents. There are three types of cards: 18 Reporter cards (2 each of an English, French and German reporter with corresponding camera and transport cards); 18 Story cards (color-coded red, blue and orange, each with 2 Event cards, 2 Place cards and 2 Interviewee cards); and 18 Document cards (red, blue and orange, each numbered 1-6).

Players collect combinations of sets, each of which can be a Reporter with matching equipment, the Event, Place and Interviewee of a color, or three consecutive Document cards of the same color.

Each player starts with 2,700 in tokens and a hand of 8 cards, and each turn draws a card and discards a card. The other players in turn order have an opportunity to buy the discard if they can use it to complete a set of three, paying 20 into the pot if they do so. Other players may overbid if eligible, paying 40, 60, etc. If the discard is not claimed, play passes to the left; if it is claimed, play passes to the claimer's left.

A hand is won when a player completes his hand with one of 7 combinations of sets. The winner takes the pot plus a score that varies with the difficulty of the combination, from 500 for two series of Reporters and one of Stories to 5,000 for three series of different Reporters. Winner of the game is first to 20,000 points.

The game box features celebrated French journalist Georges de Caunes. The artwork suggests it dates to the 1960s.

221107.description:
Description from the publisher:

The world almost ended 71 years ago...

The plague came out of nowhere and ravaged the world. Most died within a week. Nothing could stop it. The world did its best. It wasn't good enough.

For three generations, we, the last fragments of humanity have lived on the seas, on floating stations called "havens." Far from the plague, we are able to provide supplies to the mainland to keep them (and us) from succumbing completely.

We've managed to keep a network of the largest known cities in the world alive. Things have been tough the past few years. Cities far away from the havens have fallen off our grid...

Tomorrow, a small group of us head out into what's left of the world. We don't know what we'll find.

Pandemic Legacy: Season 2 is an epic cooperative game for 2 to 4 players. Unlike most other games, this one is working against you. What's more, some of the actions you take in Pandemic Legacy will carry over to future games. No two worlds will ever be alike!
221107.name: Pandemic Legacy: Season 2
boardgamepodcastepisode: WTG11 - The Board Game Leftovers Episode 2 : Great Western Trail, First Class, ZhanGuo, and News!

221108.name: Click Clack Lumberjack Promo Cards
221108.description:
16 Promo Cards for Click Clack Lumberjack, which add an additional level of fun and surprise to the game!

Each player is given a random card at the start of the game, and card gives a one time use special action which alters the way that either they or the opposing player(s) must play that round - examples include; force a player to play with their non-dominant hand, force an opponent to play a stroke with their eyes closed, instantly replace a core you knocked off

221109.description:
This is a compilation of 12 sports games. Some of them were available separately as part of the "ZDF-Sportstudio-Linie".
The games included are:

Schwimmen (tile-placement-game)
Zehnkampf (board game)
Schießen (tactical board game)
Boxen (card game)
Radrennen (board game)
Reiten (board game)
Olympia*Quiz
Handball(boardgame)
Leichtathletik (dice game)
Tennis (board game)
Hockey (board game)
Fußball (board game)
221109.name: Olympia 1988

221110.name: Candy Blast Mania
221110.description:
Match and collect candies in this delicious puzzle adventure! The Gummy Bear King and his candied cronies are looking to spoil the Candy Kingdom. Will you and your friends stop the gummied grouch before it’s too late?

Source: The Developer Website.

221112.name: Building Blocks of Life
221112.description:
In ancient times, sorcerers divided nature into 5
elements: Air, Fire, Water, Earth and Lightning.
It has been said that these five elements are the
Building Blocks of Life.

Goal of the game : To collect the most element points in your spell book.

You have one visible preferred element and one secret preferred element and 5 to 12 cards in your hand (from 5 to 2 players).

you play elements cards from your hand on the table to create a Block of Life (BoL: one card of each element) or you swap your visible or secret element with another player (and draw a card).

When you create a BoL, you pick one for your spell book and discard the rest.

The game ends automatically when one of
the following situations occur a player collects a Block of Life (a set of 5 different elements) in his spell book or specific situations suche as a player empties his hand or the drawing pile becomes empty.

221113.description:
The Arcadia Crossover Kit includes Hero Boards and Hero Cards to bring all of the Heroes from the two Arcadia Quest core boxes and two expansions to your games of Masmorra. That's a 28 Heroes, which means 28 Hero Boards and 56 Hero Cards are included in the Arcadia Crossover Kit.

The Arcadia Crossover Kit does not contain figures, if you want to properly use these Heroes, you will need to have the Arcadia Quest core box or expansion that contains their figures. Here's the complete list of the Heroes contained in this kit, and what Arcadia Quest box they come from:

Arcadia Quest:
Grom
Scarlet
Greensleeves
Johan
Maya
Seth
Kanga
Spike
Diva
Wisp
Zazu
Hobsbawm

Arcadia Quest - Inferno:
Bjor
Cassius
Diana
Izzy
Jack Jack
Jaimie
Kisha
Mark
Natasha
Phyx
Sybbyl
Trandir

Arcadia Quest - Beyond the Grave:
Chaz
Darryn

Arcadia Quest - Pets:
Greenhood
Oak
221113.name: Masmorra: Dungeons of Arcadia – Arcadia Crossover Kit

221114.description:
Unleash spectacular combos and devastating finishing moves in this jaw-dropping, butt-kicking fighting game of martial arts mash-ups! For 2-4 players.

In Samurai Punk, players assume the role of deadly warriors in an original world that blends steampunk with martial arts - samurais, ninjas, kung-fu monks, gangsters, gunslingers, knights templar, and more! Combining a Fighter deck and a Sensei deck, players create a unique fighting duo to duel against their opponents.

Combos are formed by pairing a sensei's Style cards with a fighter's Strike cards, creating one of thousands of different moves, like "Flying Kick", "Fierce Defensive Slash", and "Ultra Spinning Dragon Uppercut". Each round, new Styles or Strikes are played, replacing some cards in the players' Combos while retaining the others. Used cards store up Chi energy which can activate special abilities, making every card count. Master your duo's unique strategies and versatile combos to out-fight your opponents to victory!
221114.name: Samurai Punk

221115.name: Triolett
221115.description:
There are 3 game variations, all on the same game board. Two players Play with 12 playing pieces each.

A. Einkreisungsspiel Maja
One playing Piece of each player is called the "Maja". Which one is hidden from the Opponent (marked on the bottom). The players try to encircle the enemy pieces. Encircled pieces are taken out of the game. If the black Maja is encircled on a yellow space it may reenter the game, but if it ist encircled on a blue space the opponent has won the game. The opposite is true for the white Maja.

B. Rösselpunktspiel
The pieces start at one edge of the game board and have to reach the opposite edge. The pieces move like a chess knight. The first player to get all 12 pieces to the opposite side of the game board wins the game.

C. Türmerspiel
The pieces start at one edge of the game board and have to reach the opposite edge to turn into towers. The pieces move any number of spaces in all directions. Opposite pieces can be taken by skipping over the piece sideways to a free space directly behind it.
Pieces that reach the opposite edge of the game board, get turned into a tower by stacking a second piece on top of it. Towers may take enemy pieces (or Towers) by skipping over them not only to the space directly behind the taken piece but to several spaces behind, if there are no other pieces or towers in-between. The last player to have any playing pieces on the board wins the game.

221116.name: Somme: Life in the Saps
221116.description:
A simple yet engaging, tactical trench warfare card game themed around the misery and the glory, the hope and the despair of one the most historic battle in human history i.e. World War I - Battle of Somme. It features:

1. 2 Player fast paced action
2. Tactical turn-based strategy
3. Grinding trench warfare
4. Simple game mechanics
5. Easy to learn
6. Quick setup
7. Challenging gameplay
8. Suitability for ages 10+
9. 15-30 minutes playtime
10. and much more!

Somme: The Story

The year is 1916. A great war rages across the world. “The war to end all wars” some call it and it seems to be living up to its name, for a more terrible yet strange war the mankind had not seen before.

It is definitely nothing like those that came before it, for here the men lie, waiting, almost peacefully, in the lines they have drawn. For months together, nothing has stirred over the now, black land. No bird flies over, nor any beast roams here. The silence is almost unbearable, as the men eat, sleep and go about their business in absolute monotony.

Suddenly, the frail sense of security is shattered by a deafening noise, as a bombshell explodes nearby, causing the men to drop their jobs and scuttle for cover. One explosion is followed by another and another and another… and so the pounding goes on and on… for days and days… till all nerves are frayed and every muscle is jittery. Just when they were beginning to think that it would never stop, it ends, as abruptly, as it had started.

Deafened by the onslaught on their ears, the soldiers strain to hear, fearful of that which is to follow. Soon enough, they hear a distant pattering of feet, getting closer and closer or are they? Surely, it is the sound of gunfire that they hear now or are their ears still playing tricks on them? The men arise as if from a great slumber and peer over the parapet. What they see is incredulous, for what was earlier a barren wasteland is now a rising sea before them. Their knuckles whiten as they tighten their grips over their weapons and wait for the incoming tide to draw closer, nay, wash over them.

It is clear, that thousands will die this day and whether or not they themselves would survive, will ultimately depend on your wisdom, as their commander and the support of the brothers, by their sides. So take charge and stand fast. For the empire!

Somme: The game

Setup: To play, each player chooses and commandeers a faction, the British or the German, consisting of a squad of 8 soldiers that are laid out in a row on the table. Rest of the cards are shuffled and 15 each, are distributed to the players, of which 8, are assigned to the soldiers already on the table while the rest of the 7 are held in the player’s hand as reserve.

Strategy: Each of the fighting units under the player’s command is unique, with different loadouts and a susceptibility to specific hardships that may be exploited by the other player by playing the hardship cards. Additionally, the players’ squad as a whole, might also be affected by certain events that may be triggered by playing the event cards.

Objective: The object of the game is simple, eliminate the rival faction before they eliminate you.

Turn Mechanics: The players alternate between attacking, with a combination of Personnel Cards and assigned Attack-Defence Cards from the table and defending, with a combination of Personnel Cards and assigned Attack-Defence Cards from the table or the reserve Attack-Defence Cards from the player’s hand. According to the unique player interaction that ensues, the soldiers may either loose morale, possibly even leading to elimination or on a few rarer occasions, gain morale, coming out stronger to face another sapping day in the trenches. Both the player’s soldiers are resupplied at the end of each turn by drawing replacement cards and so the grinding war continues, till only one side remains standing.

221117.name: The World of Avlis
221117.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Avlis, traveler! Immerse yourself in a world of steel and magery, where the right path is not always what it seems, and where epic battles determine the fate of the masses. Become a part of the never-ending advance of history as you journey through fluttering paths in lush green forests, windy roads through rolling grassy plains, and miles of damp underground tunnels with your most trusted companions. You can choose to ally yourself with the orderly forces of law or the swirling forces of chaos, for good or evil, but be wary, friend! The choices you make will determine your fate and your impact on the world.

221118.name: Power Cards: Secrets of Necromancy
221118.description:
From the introduction:

This product contains power cards for all of the powers described in Secrets of Necromancy and are presented in the order in which they appear in that product.

User summary:

Item presents thirteen pages of print-and-play cards (typically nine cards per page).

221119.name: Judges Guild Journal (Issue 1 - Apr/May 1977)
221119.description:
Articles included:
Jocular Judgements
Shrewd Slants from the Sagacious Sage
Omniscient Opinions
Setting up AD&D Campaign
Demography: Someone has to Grow the Food
Tips from the Tower
Acknowledgements
And a booty list of things for sale

221120.name: Postman Pat
221120.description:
User Summary
Drive as Postman Pat in his red Royal Mail van to pick up and deliver parcels for the the village. You have three vans so avoid crashing.

While driving you may want to avoid mud puddles on the road, other trafficants, and turn at the sharp bends on the country side roads.

Three Postman Pat games were released by Alternative Software from 1989-1992 and a compilation of the three games in 1993

221121.name: Blaze Out
221121.description:
User Summary
A compilation of levels from five games that can be played with a light gun.

221122.description:
Churrascaria: A Cutthroat Game of Gluttony is a fast paced game of card collection where everyone is trying to eat all the succulent meats that appear on their plates while avoiding the equally delicious but ultimately less satisfying sides and desserts that just get in the way. All the while food theft, plate swapping, and general backstabbing keep the food flying. The person who consumes the most meat wins.

Each turn players will attempt to eat food cards from their plate, play action cards to steal food from other players or discard their sides and desserts, all while attempting to defend their own food.

When the food deck runs out players add up the scores of all the cards in their stomachs. Meats add to their score, while sides and dessert subtract from it. The player with the highest score at the end of the game wins.
221122.name: Churrascaria: A Cutthroat Game of Gluttony

221123.name: Lost Ember
221123.description:
EXPLORE THE WORLD

Discover the beauty of a world where nature has reclaimed its place from mankind. As a wolf with the power to control other animals and a determined companion on your side you'll discover ruins of old cultures and remains of long forgotten civilizations that tell you a story of hope, loss, ambition and failure.

Switch perspectives

Your main character will be the wolf. Majestic, fast and agile he is perfect to run through the woods, travel the world and hunt down all the other animals he encounters. These other animals can be possessed anytime the wolf encounters them along his journey and their special abilities are vital in some situations. Fly through the tops of the tree with a parrot, dive into the depths as a fish or dig your way to otherwise inaccessible areas as a mole - your ways of getting around are numerous.

Source: The Game Website.

221124.name: Lockdown!
221124.description:
The penitentiary is in chaos. Prisoners are on the loose and rioting, and it’s your job to restore order. To make matters more difficult, the inmates are grouped into seven factions, and you have to round up as many of these gang members as you can to have any hope of success.

Lockdown! is a streamlined, themed version of the card game Canasta, specifically designed for two players. The 64-card deck consists of 49 Gang cards and 15 Special cards. Major improvements include simplified scoring and opportunities for cunning card play.

One of the problems with Canasta is that the player (or team) which takes the inevitable, massive discard pile will usually win the round. In Lockdown!, discard piles are far more manageable, and you can even remove up to two of them from the game! (Don't worry, there's a counter to this.) Additionally, four cards will score a meld (as opposed to seven in Canasta), and of course there are incentives to go higher than four.

Lockdown! plays quickly, and most of the rules are on the cards for easy reference. First player to 100 wins the game!

221125.name: Judges Guild Journal (Issue 2 - Jun/Jul 1977)
221125.description:
Contained Articles:
Jocular Judgements
Shrewd Slants from the Sagacious Sage
Demented Demography
Religion and the Justification for Magic
Economics and Technology
Acknowledgements
Booty List

221126.name: The Lizard and the Lightning
221126.description:
An Introduction to Roleplaying in the Possibility Wars

From the introduction:

Now it is three months after the initial invasion of Earth, and the invaders’ boundaries have stabilized. The Gaunt Man’s land of horror extends across Indonesia and Malaysia, though he is no longer there to maintain it.
...
This PDF version of the introduction to the Torg roleplaying game was created from the original electronic files. Images were left out or modified and the page layout was modified to reduce file size and production time. Typographical errors were not fixed, nor was any attempt made to update the information based on any developments in the Possibility Wars since this book was first printed.

User summary:

This item originally was published (in alternate format) as part of the contents of Torg. The credits enumerated here are those noted in the document, even though most of the illustrations are absent. The document usually is distributed in an archive containing "Storm Knights/The Dark Realm/The Nightmare Dream", a (100-page PDF format) novel.

221127.name: Libellus Ultra: Denizens of  the Black 1
221127.description:
User summary:

Libellus Ultra: Denizens of the Black 1 is a sourcebook for science fiction use of the d20 Modern system. It presents six new and developed non-player characters, three new alien races, and one new starship design.

221128.name: EPICS: Deserve to Survive
221128.description:
From the introduction:

Many role-playing games, if not most of them, have character creation systems that take a long time. One character may take an hour, at least, to create. Take four Actors and you’re looking at four hours before you even get to play the game.

In EPICS, characters begin play with a basic outline, which takes only a couple of minutes. Even with a large group of people, you’ll be playing in no time.
...
[J]ust behind the scenes, hidden away from the sight of the average citizen, there are dark forces at work. Certain individuals possess strange powers, and the governments try to hide this fact by finding and "dealing" with such individuals. Even more terrifying, evil supernatural creatures exist, feeding on the unwary population of the world.

221129.name: Elemental Cross
221129.description:
From the introduction:

This product has been designed for gamers who wish to run an Elemental Cross campaign using the MADS system. Since the Elemental Cross core book already covers the "fluff," or non-game mechanic information this book will focus on the "crunch," the stuff that directly relates to the MADS system.

221130.name: Fantasy Character Hotseat
221130.description:
Warrior, Spellcaster, and Rogue

From the introduction:

Fantasy Character Hotseat provides more than 240 inspirational prompts that you can use to create interesting, unique backgrounds, goals and agendas for your fantasy characters, no matter what game system you use. This product consists of a series of questions divided into four categories, each designed to generate particular kinds of information about a character. The four categories are Background, Appearance, Training and Drive. The first category, Background, has four tables to choose from, divided into the four most common fantasy character races - human, halfling, elf and dwarf. Simply pick the one appropriate for your character’s heritage. The second table, Appearance, is divided into Male and Female. The remaining tables, Training and Drive, are divided into common fantasy career types, namely those of Warrior, Spellcaster and Rogue.

221131.name: Rosco McQueen: Firefighter Extreme
221131.description:
Rosco McQueen, a firefighter, is the protagonist of the game and he is visible from a 3rd-person perspective. McQueen must stop the game's villain Sylvester T. Square and his robotic minions. The overall objective of the game is to put out all fires before the building burns down.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosco_McQueen_Firefighter_Extreme Rosco McQueen Firefighter Extreme]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

221132.name: PoPalotsy
221132.description:
PoPalotsy is a speedy dice game in which players try to be the first to get rid of all the cards in their hand.

Players are each dealt 5 ring shaped cards - each card depicting a die face on a colored background. When all players are ready, 5 different colored dice are popped out of the provided popper. Players then race to encircle the dice with their cards by matching the color of the die or the number on the die. A number match beats a color match and an exact (color AND number) match beats all. The first player to drop all of their cards wins.

Contents:
Popper
5 Dice
40 Ring Cards
Rule Book

221133.name: Pups: Promo Pack
221133.description:
The Pups Promo Pack includes 5 new cards:

The Legendary Pups and the Underdog card can be added to any game of Pups for a new play experience!

The 4 Legendary Pups are: Cerberus, Argos, Laika and Saurr, and they respectively take the highest seat of power (10) for each suit.

The Underdog acts as a special catch-up card awarded to whatever player trails behind most in the game.

Each Pups Promo Pack also includes a rules card.

221134.name: Blend Off!: Mystery Twisters
221134.description:
Blend it like Becca has introduced their summer menu: the Mystery Twisters. For a limited time, pick your favorite fruit smoothie, and Becca will add a secret "twist."

The Mystery Twisters are added to the deck per the normal rules: always add the orange card, and then add whatever colors you are playing. Unlike the Surprise Me card, there is one restriction to the Mystery Twisters: the 4th fruit must be different than the other 3, and the durian does not count!

221135.name: G-Core: Cosmic
221135.description:
New Character Generation, Powers, and NPCs

From the introduction:

In this product you will find new powers and Hero Types based around cosmic style heroes. You might notice that some of these Hero Types also have the same Origin names as in G-Core. I did this because the Physical Stat and Mental Stat Pools come from Hero Types. If you were playing a Demi-God with a Physical Stat Pool of 50, that would be crazy. But that's not to say you can't play straight from the G-Core book. You still need it for other point information. Not to mention, if you are playing the great grandchild of a Demi-God then the straight G-Core creation is just what you need.

221136.name: G-Core Game Master Screen
221136.description:
User summary:

This three-panel screen is intended for print-and-play use. It presents common tables and rules from the core manual. The screen does not have reverse (player-side) art.

221139.name: Sticko
221139.description:
Sticko is a game by David Parlette, designed to be a solitaire game of the similar game Stucko. In this game you are trying to build up a sequence of cards based on these three resrictions:

You can only play a higher rank of the same suit, a lower rank of the opposite suit of the same colour, and the same rank of either of the opposite colour suits.

221142.name: Helicopter Simulator 2014: Search and Rescue
221142.description:
User Summary

This is not to be confused with Rescue Helicopter Simulator 2014

You take the task as an emergency pilot in one of 10 different helicopters, to go out on 45 missions conserning SAR, fire fighting and more in an area spreading over more than 400km2 with changing weather conditions.

The game also feature a Sightseeing Mode Challenge where you can explore the various locations in and try to land in sometimes tight spots.

221143.name: Fast RMX
221143.description:
Race through a futuristic sci-fi world at incredible speeds in FAST RMX.

Jump into the driver’s seat of your anti-gravity vehicle and put your skills to the test in high octane competitions. Challenge your friends to local split-screen competitions or take part in online races against players from all around the world.

Features

Race anti-gravity vehicles in this lightning-fast arcade racer
Play with anybody, anywhere you like
Zoom through 30 tracks set in canyons, alpine peaks, futuristic cities and much more
15 futuristic racing machines
Master the art of boosting and phase switching to stay ahead of the competition
Splitscreen-multiplayer with up to 4 players
Local play with up to 8 players
Online play with up to 8 players
Non stop adrenaline pumping action at 60 frames per second in 1080p
Unlock the HERO MODE to play with new rules and new challenges!

Source: The Publisher Website.

221144.name: Postman Pat 2
221144.description:
User Summary
Postman Pat's van is broken down, but the mail have to be delivered!
Control Postman Pat as he walks his route through the village; start by picking up parcels and letters, and then deliver them to the right people, but don't forget to have a nice cup of tea from time to time to regain your strenght

221145.name: Postman Pat 3: To the Rescue
221145.description:
User Summary
Delivery Man Dan have broken his leg, so Postman Pat have agreed to deliver telephone books for him.
Control Postman Pat's Royal Mail van drive-by Paperboy-style, while avoiding hazards on the road and also keeping an eye on the fuel level.
You have to deliver a certain amount of phone books in five days if Delivery Man Dan is to keep his job!

This is a licenced game of the Postman Pat television series, with the TV show's theme music as ingame music, as well as being the sequel to two the previous Postman Pat games published Alternative Software.

221146.name: The Postman Pat Hit Collection
221146.description:
User Summary
A compilation of all three Alternative Software released Postman Pat games.

221147.name: Yoku's Island Express
221147.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Yoku’s Island Express is an open world/metroidvania-style pinball adventure, Seamlessly blending platform navigation with pinball mechanics across a large open world. Yoku the dung beetle sets foot on the beach of Mokumana Island, ready to take on the duties as the new postman. But the ancient island God is trapped in a restless sleep and the islanders are plagued by quakes and storms brought forth by its nightmares. Yoku's Island Express is a unique and quirky adventure with handcrafted visuals, where you’ll soar through the air, vacuum explosive snails, fight a Screetch, feed starving lemurs, discover the mystery of the Fruit Altar, wake an old god, and hopefully help tiny Yoku rebuild the island post-office.History

Yoku's Island Express is inspired by the joy of exploration of a young child, having just found the entrance to a secret garden, or unlocked the door to an attic full of wonderful and interesting things to discover. It takes some of its direction from Studio Ghibli films, where nature is infused with spirit and life, but combined with a strong focus on painterly, hand-made visuals where all the locations are unique and hand-made. It's a world of bold, organic shapes with strong colors basking in bright sunlight - but where there is light there is shadow, and the journey takes us deep into the hidden mysteries of Mokumana Island. Villa Gorilla was founded by AAA-industry veterans Jens Andersson and Mattias snygg, working in their own proprietary engine with the goal of exploring game ideas that would never get made in big-studio environments. Working in a small 4-man group with fast iteration times, the team has struck out fresh to do something that feels personal and unique.

Features

Genre combining open world pinballing
Unique beautifully handpainted artwork
An island filled with unique creatures, both big and small
Action-packed nonlinear gameplay that awards exploration

Source: The Developer Website.

221148.name: Has-Been Heroes
videogamehonor: 2017 PAX Curse Award Best Strategy Game of the Year Winner
2017 PAX Curse Award Editor’s Choice Winner
221148.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Embark on an epic journey with the Has-Been Heroes, a group of legendary champions once celebrated throughout the kingdom – almost forgotten until the King has one more quest, the most epic of them all:TO TAKE THE TWIN PRINCESSES TO SCHOOL!

Key features
• Meet the epic band of heroes as the young and eager Rogue, joining the company of the wise monk Metacles, the giant-wrestling warrior Crux… wait until you meet the others, incl. the Anthropologist turned Mexican Wrestler, the ever-vigilant and paranoid Bodyguard, and many more!

• Unlock and collect hundreds of game-changing items and spells, boosting the heroes’ powers and making each run unique!

• Combine spells for devastating effects, learning the power of magic as you gain more elements.

• Face countless monsters, each bigger and more menacing than the next. Can you wipe out the army of evil led by the Great Ghoul?

• In roguelike fashion, die and try again – choose your heroes wisely and prepare for battle!

Source: The Developer Website.

221149.name: The Sinister Tunnels of Greenfields
221149.description:
From the publishers blurb:

"The sinister tunnels of GREENFIELDS" is an adventure for character level 1 to 3 in a universe of Heroic Fantasy.
There are no associated rules, you can use your favorite game!

The PDF contains 16 pages richly illustrated by Guillaume Tavernier. You can follow his work on Google+.

You will find with "The Sinister Tunnels of GREENFIELDS" a sorcerer, terrible rituals, forgotten dungeons .... and a little more than that.

Dive into the adventure!

221150.name: Labirynt Śmierci
221150.description:
Labirynt Śmierci (Labyrinth of Death) is a cooperative game in which players explore big and very unusual maze - this is not a typical underground, every single location may contain large areas, a big pack of monsters or even entire castle. You can meet the essence of both very bad and very good. Often, instead of fighting, you can make a deal and sometimes to gain allies...

Each player controls a group of one to three characters. These are the heroes and even gods or beasts like dragons, known from world of RPG game Kryształy Czasu (The crystals of time).
Each character is represented by two or three profession cards with different stats and skills (one of them is choosed during every encounter) and five to seven cards with spells and special powers. This are one use only with some chance to take it back.

At the beginning of the game, players choose the type of expedition and how many encounters they want to play. Single encounter involves drawing a single location (there are 250 of them), after which the players choose which profession will have their characters in this challenge. Then they find out what is happening and who they face. If there is a fight, players must collect with their parameters, spells and abilities enough Power points and Trap points to reach danger lever in this location. If they do it they acquire treasures, if they don't they receive wounds.
After all the encounters is checked whether players were able to meet the objectives related to the expedition they choose.

rpgseries: A World of Adventure for Fate Core System
221151.name: Uranium Chef
221151.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's a big universe out there, but around every star, on every planet, the old saying holds true... we all gotta eat!

The most influential, inspired, or infamous chefs in the quadrant cook on Uranium Chef, the most popular cooking/bloodsport show on the neutrowave. Tighten your apron straps and hold on tight, as you'll have to survive surprise ingredients, full-contact kitchen combat, and the snootiest food critics in five dimensions. Will you wow the judges and woo the audience? Do you have what it takes to be crowned the new Uranium Chef—or will you get the chop? "Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy" meets "Top Chef" in this new Fate World of Adventure by Dave Joria.

Uranium Chef requires Fate Accelerated to play. This 68-page supplement includes:

Over-the-top kitchen combat, complete with robot grappling, radioactive cheddar, and man-eating space monsters fricasseed in butter
Two sets of approaches, one for "reality", the other for cuisine
Complete rules for running reality show style competitions in Fate, including on-air personas, secret motivations, and GM-controlled rivals
A convenient cooking-show structure to make game creation easy, as well as plenty of sample characters, judges, and secret ingredients
A detailed scoring system to facilitate fun dish judging
A sample adventure: Out of the Frying Pan




Full contact cooking…in space!
Neutrowave channel 67,201.
Check your local spacetime listing for details.

221152.name: How The West Was Hacked: The Weird Wild West RPG
221152.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Shh. Calm down. Let him tell the story.”

“Thank ya Sheriff. It was like I said, we was tendin’ to our sheep just like any other day.”
“We got that Leroy.”

“Dammit let the man tell his story will you.”

“We was tendin’ to out sheep”

“WE GOT THAT PART LE-”

“Lester I will shoot you where you stand if you don’t let the man talk.”

“Sorry Sheriff. Go on Leroy.”

“The sheep started acting funny and then there was a huge shadow over top a’ us.”

“A shadow?”

“A big shadow, big enough to black out the sun right where we stood.”

“What happened next.”

“Well, me and Jack look up and there was the Devil. Long neck, big scaly body, forked tongue and wings stretched out the size o my ranch. Yes sir, it was the Devil. I was just standing there lookin’ up an’ a prayin’ like the good Padre taught us. Jack, he hurried up and grabbed hims gun and started firin’ away at that thing. I swear ta God that the Devil just done swooped by us and left us with the sun just a blindin’ us. It musta turned around in the air cause it came back round and spit fire. OH GOD, A DAMNABLE STREAM OF UNHOLY FIRE AND BURNT JACK RIGHT WHERE HE STOOD.”

How The West Was Hacked takes a what if look at the Wild West of cowboys and cattle rustlers and mixes it up with harpies and hobgoblins in a game based on the Black Hack rule set by David Black. Boot Hill with balrogs. The Black Hack (TBH) is a traditional tabletop roleplaying game, played with paper, pencils and dice - it uses that Original 1970s Fantasy Roleplaying Game as a base. But it adds and takes away elements to make it a distinct streamlined flavor of the original roleplaying game.

Includes an introductory adventure.

221153.name: Ghost Woods Adventure
221153.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ghost Woods Adventure is the first in a series of three old school inspired adventure modules for use with Darkfast Dungeons AND Swords & Wizardry: White Box.

A desperate dwarf seeks the help of the party to rescue his son, stolen by orcs and soon to be sacrificed by an evil death cult. It's up to the heroes to rescue the child and stop the summoning of a powerful monster.

This adventure also has information on the town of Nettle and encounter and rumour tables to keep things interesting in many fun spin off adventures.

This game opens up the Darkfast Dungeon game to more "theatre of the mind" game play, but it will require a GM to referee the game. It's a whole new way to play Darkfast Dungeons.

This adventure includes a new character class for Swords and Wizardry: White Box.

Set in the Kingdom of Richard, a series of modules and gazetteers will help flesh out this setting that I created as my original D&D campaign back in 1981.

221155.description:
In Donning the Purple players take on the role as powerful families in the Roman Empire 193 AD. The previous emperor was just killed by his own Praetorian bodyguard. The Praetorians have just put the title of emperor up for auction. If you make the highest bid you can don the purple yourself and take on the stressful job as emperor. Experience the demanding and hungry roman people, the deceiving senators and the never ending hordes of enemies on your doorstep. If you fail, the other families are ready to take over at a moments notice. While they wait for your doom they wont hesitate to backstab or undermine you as much as they can. However you all have to work together as the fall of the roman empire is closing in.

You all fight over victory points and there are multiple paths to victory. The emperor can collect lots of quick points if he can manage to keep the empire happy and not die in the process. As the opposing families wait to don the purple themselves they can also gain victory points but at a slower rate.
221155.name: Donning the Purple

221156.name: Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures (Revised)
rpg: Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures
221156.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every home needs its heroes…

Your small village seems like a haven to you and your friends, but it is not safe.

Dangerous faeries lurk in the forest just outside of town, wicked men and ferocious monsters are a constant threat, and sometimes dark forces find their way into your neighbors’ hearts. You and your companions are young and untested, but ready to protect what matters.

Come with us beyond the wall...

Lots of times, we want to play a roleplaying game but just don’t have the time for all the prep work involved. No more. Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures is a kit to make a gang of childhood friends and send them off on their first big adventure, just like in the novels we loved growing up. Now we have this simple fantasy roleplaying game that gives a group of players all the tools they need to play an exciting adventure in a single evening, no homework, no fuss.

Anyone with a background in OSR games will already be comfortable with the core rules of Beyond the Wall.

Inspired by the works of Ursula K. LeGuin, Susan Cooper, and Lloyd Alexander.
Character Playbooks and Scenario Packs for play in a single evening with no prep.
Player driven village design for fleshing out the characters’ home.
Six Character Playbooks, including the Village Hero and the Witch’s Prentice.
Two Scenario Packs: the Angered Fae and the Hidden Cult.

221158.name: RollerCoaster Tycoon Deluxe
221158.description:
From various sections of the RollerCoaster Tycoon Wikipedia article
RollerCoaster Tycoon received two expansion packs: Added Attractions (released in the US as Corkscrew Follies) in 1999, and Loopy Landscapes in 2000. Two special editions were released: RollerCoaster Tycoon Gold/Totally Roller Coaster in 2002, which contained the original game, Added Attractions/Corkscrew Follies, and Loopy Landscapes; and RollerCoaster Tycoon Deluxe in 2003, which contained the content in Gold plus more designs for the different customizable rides.

(...)

There are 21 scenarios included with RollerCoaster Tycoon, as well as 30 more in the Corkscrew Follies expansion pack, and another 30 in the Loopy Landscapes expansion pack, totaling to 81 scenarios if the whole set is installed. There are also 3 promotional scenarios released with magazines and 11 official scenarios created by Hasbro for competitions, as well as 3 real amusement parks and 1 extra park that are available in the Deluxe edition

(...)

RollerCoaster Tycoon features 22 scenarios, with the first five open from the start. Successfully completing a scenario will unlock the next one. Additionally, Mega Park is unlocked when all 21 scenarios are completed. This scenario has no objective (except "Have Fun!"), but allows the player to build on nearly the entire map, and eventually has all attractions available to build. This is the closest to a "sandbox" park, except the player does not have an unlimited amount of money to work with, only a $50,000 loan.

Some scenarios are based on real parks. For example, 'Katie's Dreamland' (Katie's World in the US Version) is based on Lightwater Valley, complete with that park's signature The Ultimate roller coaster (The Storm).

There were two official scenarios available for download from Atari's website: Fort Anachronism and Alton Towers. Alton Towers was included with the Loopy Landscapes expansion with Heide-Park and Blackpool Pleasure Beach and was updated to take advantage of the new game components. Both scenarios are also included as part of RollerCoaster Tycoon Deluxe. The UK edition of RollerCoaster Tycoon Deluxe contained Blackpool Pleasure Beach in place of Fort Anachronism.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RollerCoaster_Tycoon RollerCoaster Tycoon]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

221159.name: The Minean Nations
221159.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore the official world of Mazes & Minotaurs with this 40+ page gazetteer detailing the Minean Nations of Mythika, including:

The Three Cities of Thena, Heraklia and Argos, glorious bastions of civilization
The Island of Seriphos, the ancient birthplace of Minean culture
Islands and colonies of the Middle Sea




Includes detailed background information as well as the stats of some major NPCs such as King Theseos of Thena or the legendary Tharsus of Heraklia (Mythika's counterpart of Hercules)!

221160.name: Prometheus Protocols
221160.description:
From publisher blurb:

Book of technological marvels? Check!

Shiny new StarJammer setting?? Check!

Human super-soldiers??? …uuuuhhhh…

CHECK!

“The Prometheus Protocols” is a short product that introduces genetically-modified humans as distinct playable races for use in your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventures. Whether set in the irradiated wastes of our own upcoming Radlands, on star-galleons sailing the void in search of strange new worlds, in the back-alleys of a digitally-enhanced near-future dystopia, or hunting orcs in your favorite fantasy world, these “genies” represent what heights humanity could reach if given the right boost. You get a 10-point standard race, two 20-point advanced races, and two monstrous 30-point races, along with options for descendants of genies and for adding the genetic enhancement protocols to an existing character.

221161.name: Medved Trials
221161.description:
From publisher blurb:

Book of technological marvels? Check!

Shiny new StarJammer setting?? Check!

Human super-soldiers??? …uuuuhhhh…

CHECK!

The Medved Trials is a short product that introduces genetically-modified humans as a distinct playable race for use in your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventures. Whether set in the irradiated wastes of our own upcoming Radlands, on star-galleons sailing the void in search of strange new worlds, in the back-alleys of a digitally-enhanced near-future dystopia, or hunting orcs in your favorite fantasy world, these bears represent what heights humanity could reach if given the right boost. You get a 10-point standard race, a 20-point advanced race, and a 30-point monstrous race. They are "The Other Side's" answer to the enhanced races detailed in our product "The Prometheus Protocols," also available here.

221163.name: Strange Market Stalls
221163.description:
From publisher blurb:

The best stalls in town, only here, only today! The freshest merchandise, still has that juicy smell of something that lay in the sun for three months, until you finally came along and bought it.

Here are a few suggestions for stalls of the kind you can find in villages or small towns. Each offers examples for the types of items offered, the seller, and what can be done with the stall in your game. Dungeon World players can also make use of the new custom moves, intended to give every stall its place in the story.

221164.description:
The masterless samurai known as ‘ronin’ roam the land as mercenaries and highwaymen. The warband of Tadashi ‘the Dishonoured’ has a reputation for using bribes, dirty tricks and even poison to massacre its enemies.

Ronin have often been presented as noble figures, forced to make impossible choices while seeking revenge for the death of a beloved master. As such this set contains a range of Infamy skills which take your samurai far away from what was considered honourable behaviour.

However, just as often they ended up as mercenaries, thieves and thugs, abandoning their code for the sake of survival – so we’ve included Recruitment cards to use these models as commoner Ronin if you wish, giving you basic troops with a slightly different stat line.

Contains:

18 unique cards - including Hidden Attacker and Dangerous Reputation
1 metal character model - Tadashi ‘the Dishonoured’
5 plastic figures
5 metal 'scruffy' heads
2 mulltibases
221164.name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Ronin

221165.description:
Disinherited samurai lord Senzo ‘the Thorn’ leads a group of pauper soldiers, using his legendary skills with the bow in the hope of winning back his fortune.

Once again, the metal straw hat heads that come in this set completely change the feel of the models, making them less military and more like peasants (especially if you leave off the back-banners).

Remember each expansion set contains one type of plastic sprue, but there’s nothing to stop you mixing the heads around on bodies from other sets if you want to create a more balanced force.

The samurai archer character from this set is backed up with some useful shooty skills, plus other skills and quests that reflect him being more at home with the local peasants than most noble-born samurai.

Contains:

18 unique cards - including One with the Target and Hidden Marksman
1 metal character model - Senzo ‘the Thorn’
10 plastic figures
10 metal 'straw hat' heads
3 mulltibases
221165.name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Pauper Soldiers

221166.description:
Warrior Monk Masahiro has vowed to fight the injustices of the Japanese clans. He and his followers battle the power of the samurai, taking the armoured face-plates of their fallen enemies as badges of victory.

The stealing face-plates idea has no historical grounding, but we thought it was a cool idea that might well have happened. Perhaps more importantly it demonstrates what a different look you can create by changing the heads.

Warrior Monks meanwhile are an established part of the history of the period and had many conflicts with the ruling samurai clans. Like the other new metal character models Masahiro has his own character card (costing an extra point or two to recruit), or you can simply use one of the standard samurai cards (yes, even though monks weren’t samurai!).
221166.name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Masked Men

221167.description:
Following the murder of her husband, the widow Takeda Naoko dons the armour of a samurai and rides out to seek vengeance, all the while clinging desperately to the path of honour.

The rules for cavalry in the game are very simple (presented on the recruitment cards in this set), but adding even just one or two to your force changes things dramatically. The extra movement multiplied by 3 actions for your hero means you can get your most powerful model exactly where you need him (or her). And an all cavalry force is very interesting to play!

The onna bugeisha character (female samurai) comes with skill cards to show her sense of honour, family pride, and a haughty attitude to the low-born, plus a particularly interesting quest where you have to interrogate enemy samurai once they are vanquished to discover a secret. The idea is that she is tracking down her husband’s murderer. Could it be the ronin Tadashi?

Contains:

18 unique cards - including The Side of Right and Powerful Charge
1 metal character model - Onna Bugeisha Takeda Naoko
5 plastic mounted figures
5 metal 'neat bare' heads
221167.name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Mounted Samurai

221168.description:
Including 10 more dice plus 10 unique cards:

2 special Dishonour cards - Public Disgrace and Private Shame - which add an element of chance when you act dishonourably!
1 new Injury card - Lingering Wound - means you start the next battle in a bad way!
3 new Quest cards - including Despicable
4 new Skill cards - including Fountain of Blood, Red Mist – which makes you more awesome once wounded – and Vengeance – which kicks in if a friendly samurai is cut down!
221168.name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Dice & Cards Expansion Set

221169.name: Living Starship
221169.description:
The Living Starship co-operative tabletop game gives 1-8 players the job of crewing and operating a Corvette-class starship of 22 meeples. Utilizing worker-placement, dice-rolling, and resource management, the ship and its crew must complete missions in order to keep the local planetary system from collapsing into disarray.

Living Starship is a multi-platform and ongoing experience that includes a legacy-style tabletop game, a mobile match-3 game, and encourages story-telling in a growing fictional setting. Gameplay is inspired by elements of board games, sci-fi and fantasy entertainment, LARP, and story telling. The destiny of the Citadel cosmos is in your hands.

221173.description:
Full expansion for Ophidian 2360 Futuristic Gladiator Combat Game! Original mechanics, great art, with new keywords, mechanics, and more!

This expansion adds additional Minions, Quick-Hits, Pumps, and more!
221173.name: Ophidian 2360: Hostile Takeover

221175.name: High Heavens: Valkyrie & Medusa Expansion
221175.description:
Add variety to your games by bringing these new gods to the battle. Turn fallen gods into stone statues with Greek goddess Medusa, or escort fallen Norse gods back to field with the help of the Valkyrie. This expansion comes with two God Cards and two miniatures.

High Heavens: Valkyrie & Medusa includes:


Medusa Plastic figure (unpainted)
Valkyrie Plastic figure (unpainted)
2 god Cards
Rules

221176.name: High Heavens: Terrain Expansion
221176.description:
Change the very landscape that the gods traverse with the High Heavens: Terrain set. Players can bring passive and active terrain features to the board for all new tactical play. Ymir’s Bones create two impenetrable zones while the two monsters, Scylla and Charybdis wreak havoc with those gods foolish enough to approach them.

High Heavens: Terrain includes:


Rules
4 Plastic terrain figures
2 terrain cards

221177.name: High Heavens: Bloodied Expansion
221177.description:
Alter your decks with the all-new High Heavens: Bloodied pack expansion. Replace all of your god cards or use these cards to deck-build a custom set up. These Greek and Norse cards contain the original line-up of Norse and Greek gods but present the gods as battle-worn with new art and modified stats.

High Heavens: Bloodied includes:


Rules for deck building
12 Greek god Bloodied cards
12 Norse god Bloodied cards

221178.name: Aphrodite
221178.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Goddess of Love and Beauty

Since the banishment of the gods from Olympus by the titan Hecate, Aphrodite has secretly reunited with her true love, Ares. Together, they travel the world in search of excitement. This often leads to violence, as Ares incites war and conflict wherever he goes. When Aphrodite grows tired of Ares and his predilection for war, she seeks out a handsome mortal lover to spend some time with...

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

221179.description:
Description from the publisher:

Geopolitics Boardgame is a game of geopolitical dispute where the newly emerging World Order Cold War and bipolarity, presents a scenario of unimultipolarity, in which a single superpower interacts with significant regional powers (which tend to oppose the main power), and With numerous secondary powers (which, in general, align with the Superpower and oppose the regional power of its geographical area). The significant strength of some regional powers, concerned with the US struggle for global hegemony, has been hampering this purpose.

One of the players will represent the USA and the other regional powers (Russia, China, United Kingdom or Germany and Brazil), each with its own advantages and peculiarities, that will fight for the balanced world, each one trying to conquer to challenge the unimultippality through the war , Trade, politics, diplomacy and technological progression.

After extensive research in the military area, 50 technological advances of 5 different types (infrastructure, naval, air, land and missile) were incorporated.

With a double board, magnificent meeples of military units (army, special forces, APC, tank, artillery, corvette, destroyer, frigate, cruiser, submarine, transport ship, helicopter, fighter, bomber, tactical air transport, SAM, industrial complex ) Plus tokens including cruise missile and nuclear missile, hundreds of cards, custom dice, sideboards, playmates.

Geopolitics Boardgame has a structure of game in rounds with 3 phases:

I) In the Strategy Phase, players choose one of the 8 strategy cards (leadership, diplomacy, politics, production, commercial, war, technology, geopolitics), each of which has an initiative value that determines the order of the game. Each card has a primary skill that will be used exclusively by the player who chooses the card and a secondary skill that can be used by other players at the necessary costs.

II) In the Action Phase, players will be able to use the chosen strategy card, activate territories on the board to move troops and diplomatic leaders to raise influence and resources, build military units, recruit and / or fund weapons and militants from rebel and terrorist groups, To celebrate political-military alliances, to attack opponents, to conclude trade agreements, to propose voting of treaties in international organizations, to research technological advances and to use action letters.

III) In the Status phase players can qualify for 1 geopolitical goals per round, including pipeline control, technological development, military and diplomatic goals.

Win the game that finishes first 10 goals.

The "designer notes" in the rule book humbly recognize the inspiration of such games as Twilight Imperium, Twillight Struggle, Imperial 2030 and Supremacy.
221179.name: Geopolitics Boardgame

221180.name: Black Goat of New Orleans
221180.description:
From the Publisher:

Deep in the interior of undeveloped City Park, the unmistakable reek of barnyard, the pungent muskiness of post-sex, and the iron buffet of raw meat sautés in the humid November night of 1928. This is survival of the fittest, the most cunning, the least merciful, as an outer god’s first-born male recruits his army. Only the best will do. The rest shall die. Loosely based on a century-old, actual New Orleans urban legend, “Black Goat” will rake your investigators over the coals, perhaps branding cloven hoof-prints across their mortal hides. With this and all forthcoming investigations, New Orleans Mythos’ mission is to deliver dark, pulpy, cinematic hybrids splicing actual New Orleans urban legends with unwholesome Mythos goodness.

221181.name: Kaiju Incorporated: The Roleplaying Game
221181.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Job's a Monster!

Jump into the lives of the workers for the world’s biggest multinational Kaiju-conglomerates! Rebuilding the world following giant monster attacks takes a Kaiju-sized work-force. Do you have what it takes to face the hazards of mayhem, destruction, biohazardous waste, human resources, minimal career prospects, and really really big footprints? Find out in Kaiju Incorporated: The Roleplaying Game!

Kaiju Incorporated: The Roleplaying Game is full color supplement for Fate Core or Fate Accelerated. Inside, you’ll find:

Different types of Kaiju cleanup crews to make each campaign unique
Mode-based character generation to easily create a balanced crew
Hybrid stunts which offer more power for the character and more Fate points for the GM
A Kaiju attack checklist to help GMs easily plot their next session or campaign
Plenty of Kaiju and corporate employers to get your crew started




We will not be stopped by pools of goo, flying debris, bad traffic, or ridiculous HR policies! We will rebuild!

User note: based on the card game Kaiju Incorporated.

221182.name: The Tomb of the Fifth Colossus
221182.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Game of the North – the Tomb of the Fifth Colossus is a module intended to introduce the system and the rudiments of the broader setting called The North. Each Referee and each player in the North will create their own narrative, their own adventures. This module is intended to give insights on how to run the game and how to play the game while providing a setting, an adventure characters, gear & backgrounds for ease of play.

If you are running this adventure you can feel free to read the entirety of the module and all of the pre-generated characters & monsters records.

If you plan to play as a PC in this adventure and its further campaign you shouldn’t read much further. You’ll want to select one each of the accompanying materials – you’ll want one Character, one Gear Sheet and one of the Your Story So Far sheets. You can and maybe even should randomly select each of these.

221183.name: Tombs of the Adamant Colossi Player's Guide
221183.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here is your guide to playing an adventurer or running an adventure as a referee in the Tombs of the Adamant Colossi campaign setting.
